pages.name: Free admission to Tampere Art Museum
pages.descriptionShort: There is free admission to the Tampere Art Museum on certai Fridays during 2025.
pages.descriptionLong:
Surrealism – A Collective Dream

8.2.–10.8.2025


Tampere Art Museum’s large-scale international exhibition displays Surrealism’s visions of reality as the movement celebrates its centenary and presents encounters between its pioneers and prominent contemporary artists. Central themes include identity, gender, technology and mental health viewed from different perspectives.


The exhibition examines Surrealism and its impacts from the 1920s to the present day. The works of the original Surrealists engage with the interpretations of succeeding generations. The dialogue between these works shows that Surrealism is not just an historical movement, but rather one whose influence extends up to the present day. The themes and subjects of the avantgarde seem more topical today than ever.

pages.name: Pilot of the multi-arts course "Time Travel in Haihara" for seniors
pages.descriptionShort: The introductory workshop for the Time Travel course will be held at Haihara Manor on June 6th from 10 am to 12 pm.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Time Travel course uses art to explore time: memories, the present and the future.

Participants will be able to explore and share important stages of their own lives, reflect on the present and build future images through easy creative methods. Methods used include image, movement and writing exercises. Participation in the course is free of charge and does not require any previous interest in art. The content will be tailored based on the wishes and interests of the participants.

The course lasts 12 times. Meetings are once a week on Fridays from 10 am to 12 pm from 5.9. to 28.11.2025.

The introductory workshop for the Time Travel course will be held at Haihara Manor on 6.6. 10–12.

All seniors interested in creativity are welcome to join.

The course is led by visual artist Inka Hannula and theatre teacher, TeM and dance and movement therapist Mirka Weimer. 

Further inquiries and registration: 
Mirka Weimer
mirkaweimer@gmail.com

pages.descriptionShort: In circus workshops, Tue-Fri, 3rd-6th June from 10 am to 2 pm, we will get to know different types of circus and different circus equipment! Aimed at over 6 years old, no prior skills required.
pages.descriptionLong:
At Rulla's circus workshops, Tue-Fri, June 3rd-6th from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m., we will get to know different types of circus and different circus equipment! The director is Jarmo Skön from Tampere taidekasvatus ry. How does a juggler start training? How did the somersault go? How to learn balancing, how is it used and when does it stop? Circus workshops have circus magic!


In the workshop, you will get to know different types of circus and various circus equipment, such as juggling balls, plates and flower sticks.


The course is aimed at over 6-year-olds, no previous skills are required. The workshops are held in the Kulttuuritalo Laikku Music Hall. If the weather permits, there will also be a circus in Kirjastonpuisto park. You can register for one or more days.


Advance registration opens on Rulla's website on May 26th at 2 p.m.


Registrants/participants will receive more detailed instructions before the workshops begin.


Changes are possible!

pages.name: Summer Park Concerts: Katri Hannele
pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. 

At 11 AM Katri Hannele
In singer-songwriter Katri Hannele's atmospheric Finnish music, delicate lyrics intertwine with beautiful melodies. Her songs capture the small moments of life filled with great emotions, paint with the many shades of love, and balance in the crosscurrents of internal and external pressures. Katri Hannele performs as a duo with pianist Lumi Suomalainen. Katri Hannele has released three singles: “Perhosen siiven muotoiset kellukkeet”, “Syli” and “Otava”, which will be completed into a debut EP in the spring of 2025.

See you in Tampere Summer Park Concerts!

pages.name: Disability Pride 2025
pages.descriptionShort: Welcome to celebrate the second Disability Pride in Finland and Tampere! The goal of the event is to show that being disabled is no cause for shame. This year's theme is working life.
pages.descriptionLong:
Welcome to celebrate the second Disability Pride in Tampere, Finland! The human rights organisation Amnesty's local activists in Tampere organise the event together with other volunteers.

The goal of the event is to show that it is not shameful to be disabled. Disabled people are not defective or invisible. They are a part of the Finnish society. This year the main theme is employment.


The speeches are interpreted into Finnish Sign Language.


Programme:

13.30–14.00: A short march from Keskustori to Artteli.

14.00–16.00 speeches and music at Hepokattisali in Artteli


Speakers:

- Katja Metsävainio

- Elina Nykyri and Eleonora Mäkinen

- Riikka Leinonen

- Julianna Brandt-Smal

- Pinja Eskola

- Niko Halminen,

- Henna Suikki


Music:

- Duo Eve & Veera

- Aizhan Sultan


Artteli has provided detailed accessibility information on its website, but it is only in Finnish. You can find it here: https://www.artteli.fi/saapuminenesteettomyys.html. If you have questions about the accessibility of the event or the space, feel free to contact us!


We expect all participants to follow the guidelines for a safer space. They are:

1. Respect everyone's personal space, both physical and mental. For example, ask before you touch anyone. Listen to others. Change your behaviour if it makes someone feel uncomfortable.

2. Respect everyone. Don't assume people's characteristics. They include:

- sexuality

- gender

- nationality

- religion

- values

- education and economic situation

- ability

- health

Refer to people with the names and words they ask you to use. Be aware of your own privileges, for example, wealth and skin colour.

3. Respect other people's opinions and experiences. Don't make fun of or humiliate anyone.

4. Take responsibility of your actions and behaviour. We can affect others' wellbeing when we take notice of others as well.

5. Give others space. Do your best to make sure that everyone gets to speak.

6. If you see harassment, tell the organisers. You can also ask if the harassed person wants help or support.

Join us to make disabled people seen and heard!

pages.name: Laikku and the Whole World Cultural festival 2025
pages.descriptionShort: The most colourful event in town
pages.descriptionLong:
Laikku and the Whole World Cultural festival will be celebrated for the third time on Saturday, June 7th. The event, which celebrates the diverse culture of Tampere, will fill Laikunlava and Kirjastonpuisto with music, dance, and art! In case of a very bad weather, the event will be arranged indoors Culture House Laikku and Children's Cultural Centre Rulla.


Laikunlava programme:

14.15 União da Roseira 

14.35 Kanzashi 

15.05 DJ Renaz

15.30 Banda Caribe Helsinki

16.15 DJ Renaz

16.45 Dance studio Rio-dance

16.50 Saïsba Intercontinental Septet

17.40 DJ Renaz


Performers at Laikunlava stage:

Uniâo da Roseira - A rhythmic and colorful samba show invites on a journey to hot Brazil and draws you into an energetic carnival atmosphere.

Saïsba Intercontinental septet - The music of this Afro-fusion band blends West African traditions with Afrobeat, rock, funk, jazz, and Latin rhythms.

Banda Caribe Helsinki - The band plays traditional Cuban boleros, popular hot Latin hits, danceable lively timba, and romantic bachata.

Kanzashi - A band of three Japanese women performing captivating chanson and film music accompanied by a barrel organ.

Dance studio Rio-Dance: Rio Dance is part of the club activities of the Russian Club in Tampere. Children and young people of various ages practice dance at the studio.


The host and DJ of the event is journalist, DJ, and activist Renaz Ebrahimi.


There will also be KorentoArt's characters and art workshops for children at 14-17 and Art Live -programme by Somana ry. at 15-17.

At the food market, you can find delicacies from Arabic cuisine and Bangladeshi street food.


Participants in the event's market area are: Tampereen ukrainalaisten yhdistys Suomessa ry, Ukraina Talo, artisan Hilton Marowa, Lähi-idän naisten yhdistys, Äetsän Seudun Kehitysmaaseura ry., henna artist Tahmina Akter, Hola Tampere, Tampere-Tartto-Seura, Tampere Intercultural Art, Bloom ry., artisan Atkia Waseka Rahma, Kulttuuriosuuskunta Uulu ja Hengaa täällä -project.



Free entry.

pages.name: Surrealism – A Collective Dream
pages.descriptionShort: The international exhibition displays Surrealism’s visions of reality as the movement celebrates its centenary and presents encounters between its pioneers and important contemporary artists.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Surrealism exhibition deals with the world of the subconscious and the instability of reality through the works of avant-garde artists like Max Ernst, Yves Tanguy, René Magritte, Joan Miró, Man Ray, Salvador Dalí, Luis Buñuel and Claude Cahun and the work of contemporary artists like Cindy Sherman, Tony Oursler, Penny Slinger, Yayoi Kusama, Sarah Lucas and David Lynch. Central themes include identity, gender, technology and mental health examined from different perspectives. The media work of the world-famous contemporary artist and filmmaker Marco Brambilla Heaven´s Gate (2022) is shown in the basement gallery of the museum as part of the exhibition.


The writer André Breton published the first Surrealist Manifesto in Paris one hundred years ago on 15th October 1924. It brought about a revolutionary cultural movement whose ideas and practices spread all over the world and continue to exert an influence in the present day.


A century after the birth of the movement, Surrealist thinking is once again extremely topical. In an age of great change and unrest, we are creating new visions of reality. Political and social instability, crises and wars, ever accelerating change and uncertainty about the future are unsettling our view of the world. Questioning our own conception of reality has once again assumed a central position, and old questions re-emerge in our search for answers. Looking at Surrealist works over a hundred years opens up alternative perspectives stretching from the past to the present. 


The exhibition examines Surrealism and its impacts from the 1920s to the present day. The works of the original Surrealists engage with the interpretations of succeeding generations. The dialogue between these works shows that Surrealism is not just an historical movement, but rather one whose influence extends up to the present day. The Surrealist stance reflects a way of thinking that is based on incompleteness and continual change. The interaction between the art of different decades makes the themes and subjects of the avantgarde seem more topical today than ever. The search for identity, transformation, irrationality, the questioning of reality and perception are all dealt with in contemporary works of art that bear a Surrealist stamp. 


The exhibition, which is divided thematically into six sections shows how Surrealist practices have called the present and the future into question in a critical and humorous way over the generations right up to the present day. 


The over 100 works on show in the exhibition present the diversity of Surrealist art: paintings, prints, sculptures, photographs and films.


The exhibition has been organized in cooperation with the German Institut für Kulturaustausch.

pages.name: What on Earth? - Fairytale Crafts
pages.descriptionShort: What on Earth? - Fairytale Crafts: Craft and Design School Näpsä's Spring Exhibition.
pages.descriptionLong:
What on Earth? – Fairytale Crafts is an exhibition of children's crafts made during the 2024-2025 school year, where you can get to know diverse and imaginative works. The works are inspired by fairytales and stories. The artists, whose names appear under the artists' names, have hidden references to both familiar and unknown stories, works and introductory texts. Visitors have a great opportunity to create their own stories alongside the works.


Welcome to the world of stories, where imagination knows no bounds.


School of Crafts and Design Näpsä is an educational institution for basic education in the art of crafts, where in addition to manual skills, creativity, courage, problem-solving skills and perseverance are taught. Students themselves have the opportunity to influence the design of the works, and during the school year they work in a variety of different craft techniques.


Exhibition in the exhibition space of the Children's Cultural Centre Rulla, on the first floor of the Culture House Laikku.

Keskustori 4, Tampere.  


Open Wed 12-18, Thu – Fri 9-14 and Sat – Sun 10-16. Free admission!


The exhibition opening will be held on April 5th starting at 11 am.

pages.name: Between the Surfaces
pages.descriptionShort: The textile work Between Surfaces will have its premiere with the Pirkanmaa dance collective Luontosalaseura on May 10, 2025 at Tampere Main Library Metso.
pages.descriptionLong: The installation Between Surfaces takes a stand on the explosive growth of spruce pests in commercial forests in Pirkanmaa due to global warming. Monoculture and unsustainable forest management in commercial forests are causing extensive spruce damage, which is accelerated by warming summers and mild winters. The work considers what kind of life bookworms and polygraphists, those other species of small bark beetles, live in commercial forests and what kind of destruction they slowly cause. Despite their destructive power, they consider spruces their refuge, and I wonder if people do the same with their clothes. The Nature Secret Society will present a moving performance in the work on the opening day, May 10, 2025, starting at 2:00 PM. The dance collective includes Tuuti Touhunen and Oona Leinonen, masters of dance arts, and musician Anna Pesonen.The performance lasts approx. 20 minutes.

pages.name: Pirkkalaistori Summer market Wednesdays
pages.descriptionShort: Pirkkalaistori is a meeting place in the heart of Nokia. The busiest market day is Wednesday, when there is live music or other performances in the market square in June and July starting at 11 am.
pages.descriptionLong:
The summer Pirkkalaistori is a lively meeting place in the heart of Nokia, where traditional market culture is alive and well. At the market you can enjoy a diverse range of offerings, fresh vegetables, delicious pastries, crafts, clothes and much more.

The weekly market day is Wednesday, but especially during the summer there are vendors at other times too. Two barbecue carts and an ice cream kiosk serve at Pirkkalaistori every day.

A particularly attractive market day is Wednesday, when there is live music or other performances at the market starting at 11 am. Performances are held in June and July, weather permitting, and last approx. 30 - 60 min.

Come and enjoy performances by local musicians and let the music bring joy and atmosphere to your shopping holiday.

Here are the performers for the 2025 Wednesday Markets. Changes are possible.

pages.name: Rope speed dates
pages.descriptionShort: Finding new friends and community through ropes can be challenging, and finding a new ropes partner can be even harder. We want to improve your chances with speed dating.
pages.descriptionLong:
Finding new friends and a community in the ropes hobby can be challenging, and finding a new ropes partner is even more difficult. We want to provide a space where the threshold for meeting new people is as low as possible. This event offers a relaxed and safe space to find new acquaintances and potential ropes partners.


We will start the event with light group discussions and icebreakers that will help you talk about your hopes and expectations in the ropes community and ropes partners. Are you looking for a training buddy or a companion for workshops? Are you interested in rope dating, and if so, in what format? Or do you need a friend to attend jams and events with? After the group discussions, the actual speed dating part begins, where you can chat, try tying or just follow the atmosphere.


The event is open to all genders and experience levels. You don't need any previous experience with ropes: The most important thing is an open mind and a desire to meet new people.


We will be organizing three Rope speed dates on Monday, June 9th, 2025. The event will be a walk-in event and each start will accommodate 20 people. Starts at 4:30 PM, 6:30 PM and 8:30 PM. We will open the doors of Unisex at 3:30 PM. If there are spaces available, you can participate in more than one start.


Come along to find community, new friends and maybe the right rope partner for you.

The event is organized by Unisex and rope artist My_May.


More information: tapahtumat@unisex.fi

pages.name: Pop-up café:  cupcakes and rainbow politics
pages.descriptionShort: Welcome to atmospheric stone kiosk on Annikinkatu in Tammela to enjoy vegan delicacies and talk to MP and city councilor Oras Tynkkynen about rainbow politics!
pages.descriptionLong:
The atmospheric little stone kiosk on Annikinkatu opens its doors and transforms into a pop-up rainbow café in honor of the opening day of Pride Week. Coffee, tea, juice, vegan delicacies and relaxing music will be served. Member of Parliament and city councilor Oras Tynkkynen will be joining the event, and welcomes everyone to chat about rainbow politics and any other issues that come to mind. Welcome to stop by for a quick coffee or enjoy the unique summer evening atmosphere for a longer time!


Accessibility information: The event venue is on the corner of quiet little streets. There is a steep hill when arriving from Pohjolankatu, but from other directions the route is flat and easy to use. There is plenty of space for getting off the car, but you may have to look for a parking space further away. The bus stop is few street corners away. There are no toilets at the event venue. You can bring an assistant or a guide dog. There is no induction loop available. The kiosk window is at standing height, but it is easy to make your order without reaching the window. The event organizers will help when needed, for example by reading the menu aloud or bringing the servings to wheelchair users. There are some chairs for resting.

We will gather on June 9th at the Transfeminiinit Ry office at Näsilinnankatu 48 D, 4th floor, at 5:00 PM. From there, we will head together to Eteläpuisto, where we will enjoy the pride picnic. pages.name: Oh Dear Body! Queer tantra on Pride week
pages.descriptionShort: For all queer beings – a gentle invitation to connect with your body just as it is. No nudity or sexual content. Consent-based touch only. A safer space for presence, connection, and deep embodiment.
pages.descriptionLong:
Date & Time: June 9th, 6–8:30 PM – doors open at 5:45 PM

Location: Rihmos Binding Studio, Näsilinnankatu 22A, 2nd floor (not fully accessible – details below)

Price: €35/person, incl. 25.5% VAT


🌈 For all queer beings – a gentle invitation to experience and love your body just as it is, in your own truth and in connection with others.

No nudity, no gendering, no sexual elements. All touch is optional and always based on clear consent. This event follows safer space principles and an equality commitment.

Grounded, loving presence and conscious touch open deeper connection with your own body and others. We’ll explore solo and partnered presence practices, consensual touch in pairs or small groups, and playful full-group exercises. Most practices take place on soft mats, close to the ground.


🎟️ Buy your ticket here!


Your Guide

I’m Silja Helinä – a smiling, grounded and safe space holder. I believe life is meant for joy and love. In my work, I value storytelling, flow, and clarity. I’ve spent my life supporting people. I’m a Tantric Life Coach, certified mental coach, relationship advisor, and midwife.


As a Tantric Life Coach, I help you find an alive connection to your emotions and your body. To me, tantra is a path of self-discovery – training the body and mind, walking a spiritual path, and exploring what it means to be human.


In neotantra, we explore practices that help you access the deep feelings that live inside you. Layer by layer, old habits, social conditioning and limiting patterns peel away, revealing the beautiful, authentic you. From this place, true connection becomes possible, with yourself and others.


Shadow work- recognizing your own wounds and triggers- is part of this journey. Through breathwork and body-based exercises, your senses become more sensitive and open to pleasure- perhaps more than you ever thought possible. I will always meet you with love, never from above.


My events follow safer space principles, where everyone is welcome as they are. Discrimination, judgment, or harassment is not tolerated. If you experience inappropriate behavior, please speak to me or a support person immediately.


My work is ethical and transparent. In couple exercises, I gently guide you and your partner toward deeper intimacy through tantric practices. I offer tantric coaching, mental coaching and group events for individuals and couples.


Accessibility info

This venue is not fully accessible: a small 3cm threshold and doorsteps must be crossed to enter. There is elevator access, but the bathroom is not wheelchair accessible. The toilet is gender-neutral.

No guide dogs allowed, and there is no induction loop.

This event is for adults (18+). Exercises take place both standing and on the floor.

You can arrive by car or public transit. Tullinsuu stop is the nearest. Paid street parking is available nearby.

pages.name: Gender-sensitive swimming pool shift
pages.descriptionShort: Manse Pride Week's dedicated swimming pool shift for gender minorities
pages.descriptionLong:
Everyone has the right to exercise in a safe environment!

On Monday, June 9, 2025, from 6:00 to 8:30 PM, we are organizing a safe and sensitive swimming pool session for gender minorities in Tampere.

We will share the name of the swimming pool when we confirm your registration, no later than Sunday, June 8, at 6:00 PM.

During this session, it is also allowed to use a swimsuit or a towel in the shower and sauna areas even if you do not have a membership pass.

There will be no other groups in the pool area during this time, so you can use the pool and changing rooms freely.

Register using this form:

You are welcome to join if:

✅ You feel safe swimming in a sensitive atmosphere together with other members of gender minorities, trans, and non-binary people. You may be, for example, trans, non-binary, agender, intersex, queer, gender fluid, cross-dressing, or questioning your gender identity.

✅ You can use the same changing room with everyone else.

✅ You are an adult.

✅ You can commit to a confidential and respectful atmosphere for all.

We will send a confirmation to all registered participants by 6:00 PM on Monday, June 8.

Welcome! ❤

Sinuiksi ry is providing this swimming session. Participation is free!

pages.name: Manse Pride programme in the Moomin Museum
pages.descriptionShort: The Museum's Studio is open all day all week with a guided paper architecture workshop. There are also guided queer themed tours in Finnish every day.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Moomin Museum is an experiential art museum for Moomin fans and art lovers of all ages. Visit us and relive the adventures of the beloved Moomin family in our permanent exhibition of Tove Jansson’s original illustrations. Experience the magic of Moominvalley by stepping inside the Hobgoblin’s Hat, marvel at our beautifully crafted tableaux, and be amazed by our sparkling comet soaring across the sky!


The Museum's Studio is open all day all week with a guided paper architecture workshop. Let's make the whole valley full of Moomin Houses!


There are also guided queer themed tours in Finnish every day, Tue-Fri at 5 pm and Sat-Sun 4pm.


ACCESSIBILITY


You can read more about the accessibility of the Moomin Museum here.


ARRIVAL


The Moomin Museum is located at the Tampere Hall, address Yliopistonkatu 55. You can find more information about arrival here.


SAFER SPACE PRINCIPLES


At the Moomin Museum everyone can feel safe to be themselves and feel welcome. We follow the legislation on non-discrimination and equality in force in Finland as well as the Safer Space Principles.
pages.imageAlt: The Moomin Troll statue is holding a rainbow umbrella.

pages.name: Senior Day at the Tampere Art Museum
pages.descriptionShort: Senior's admission only 4 € all day.
pages.descriptionLong:
On the Seniors' Day, the admission for a senior is only 4 € all day.


Surrealism – A Collective Dream

8.2.–10.8.2025


Tampere Art Museum’s large-scale international exhibition displays Surrealism’s visions of reality as the movement celebrates its centenary and presents encounters between its pioneers and prominent contemporary artists. Central themes include identity, gender, technology and mental health viewed from different perspectives.


The exhibition examines Surrealism and its impacts from the 1920s to the present day. The works of the original Surrealists engage with the interpretations of succeeding generations. The dialogue between these works shows that Surrealism is not just an historical movement, but rather one whose influence extends up to the present day. The themes and subjects of the avantgarde seem more topical today than ever.



Welcome!

pages.name: Adults' Evening in Rulla
pages.descriptionShort: Paint & chill in the children's cultural centre
pages.descriptionLong:
Children's Cultural Centre Rulla is located on the first floor of the Culture House Laikku. It is a colorful, stimulating, and grounding art and exhibition space. Normally, Rulla serves only children and families, but during Pride week, we open the doors exclusively for adults, for one night only. During the Adults' Evening, you can explore the exhibition and play areas in peace, rest, read, meditate, listen to audiobooks or music (with headphones), take a nap, and participate in a guided art workshop inspired by Tove Jansson's worldview and art.

In the Art workshop at 17, we will try painting with acrylics and mixed techniques and create our own artwork. The workshop celebrates the 80th anniversary of the Moomins and Tove Jansson's unique creativity and attitude towards life. Tove Jansson (1914–2001) was a writer, visual artist, and illustrator who loved work and life, and her production is a celebration of humanism, colors, and storytelling. She is best known as the creator of Moominvalley and the Moomin stories. Tove surrounded the Moomins with numerous friends – the community and the power of art carry the trolls through life. The world of the Moomins is built on adventure and inclusion, where different perspectives are heard. (Source: tovejansson.com)

The message of Manse Pride 2025 "We are one big family" fits perfectly with Tove's stories about a safe place that can be called home. In the art workshop, we strengthen the feeling of hope, the importance of belonging, and the freedom of self-expression through art. The art workshop is led by visual artist Zeynep Kaynar / Tampere Intercultural Art.


The exhibition space at Rulla features the spring exhibition of the Handicraft and Design School Näpsä What on Earth? Fairytale Crafts.

The entrance to Rulla is from the end of Laikku facing Tampere Theatre. Outdoor shoes cannot be worn in Rulla; there is coat rack space and lockable lockers in the lobby. We kindly ask you to keep smart devices silent during the visit.

The evening concludes with Pride concert: Narrikoira & Kiukkupussy and Elsi Sloan at 19:00 on Laikunlava!


Free entry. Taking part in the art workshop is also free of charge.

pages.name: Discussion panel: Families under the rainbow, past and present
pages.descriptionShort: A panel discussion on the history and present-day experiences of LGBTQ+ families and parenting.
pages.descriptionLong:
Panel Discussion: LGBTQ+ Families Then and Now
Part of the Manse Pride 2025 Program

Join us for a thought-provoking panel on the history and present-day realities of LGBTQ+ families and paths to parenthood.

The discussion will be moderated by Mico Ylimäki (Sinuiksi ry). Panelists include Juha Jämsä (Sateenkaariperheet ry), Satu Lehtinen (Adoptioperheet ry), and Satu Moilanen (Simpukka ry).

This event is organized by Sinuiksi ry as part of the official Manse Pride program.

LGBTQ+ people have long shared the dream of starting families—just like anyone else. But what has that journey looked like in the past? Is it easier today? What societal challenges still exist, and what opportunities are now available for LGBTQ+ individuals and couples to become parents?

You’re warmly invited to join us for a panel full of personal stories, insights, and reflections on the joys and challenges of building families under the rainbow.

Event Details

Location: Werstas Museum, Finlayson area, central Tampere

Walking distance:
~10 minutes (600 m) from Keskustori via Aleksis Kiven katu
~20 minutes (1.4 km) from the Tampere Bus Station

Nearest bus stops are on Satakunnankatu (200 m from the museum)

Easily accessible by tram or bus

pages.name: Rainbow History Walk
pages.descriptionShort: In honor of Manse Pride Week, Sinuiksi ry is organizing two rainbow history-themed walks. The walks start at Laukontori. The walk lasts approximately 1.5 hours.
pages.descriptionLong:
In honor of Manse Pride Week, Sinuiksi ry is organizing two rainbow history-themed walks. The walks start on Tue 10.6. and Fri 13.6. at 6:00 PM from Laukontori. The walk lasts approximately 1.5 hours, ending at Otavalankatu. Participation in the walks is free of charge.


Welcome to the parade sites of Tampere's rainbow history to see and learn! We will follow the principles of a safer space at the event. You can read the principles in advance here: https://yhdistys.sinuiksi.fi/toiminta/turvallisempi-tila/


Accessibility of the venue and movement: The starting point Laukontori is accessible without barriers. The route follows the street network, on sidewalks and in park areas, as well as dirt roads/paths. There are no stairs along the route. There are traffic barriers at the street crossings, lowered at pedestrian crossings. In Hämeenpuisto, the route between Satamakatu and Kauppakatu is uphill. Route: Laukontori – Satamakatu – Hämeenpuisto (park dirt road) – Kauppakatu – Frenckelli via the bridge to Koskipuisto (where there is also a dirt road) – Hatanpää highway – Otavalankatu.


Accessible parking space: There are some public accessible (streetside) parking spaces near the starting point Laukontori and the finishing point Otavalankatu, but their availability cannot be guaranteed. You can participate in the event with an assistant and/or guide dog. During the event tour, the speech will be announced through a portable loud speaker. The route mainly takes you through smaller streets and the park, but there may be more traffic noise, especially in the Hämeenpuisto and Hatanpää highway areas.


You can ask Klaus for more information by email: klaus@sinuiksi.fi.

pages.name: Summer Park Concert Goes Pride: Elsi Sloan, Kiukkupussy & Narri Koira
pages.descriptionShort: On the Laikunlava outdoor stage, you can see drag and hear wonderful, opinion-provoking music.
pages.descriptionLong:
During Manse Pride week, the Summe Park Concerts will also be in a Pride mood!


At 7 PM Kiukkupussy & Narri Koira

Kiukkupussy is sexy, cool and a little stinky. Narri Koira is a desperate fruittari.

Together they have spread the good news of gay eroticism all over Finland and have made an impact especially on the underground drag scene in Tampere. You may have seen them at Tavara-asema's Kväär events, Mansedrag at Kulttuuritalo Telakka and at numerous nightclubs and Pride events. Now Kiukku and Narri are celebrating the awesome Manse Pride all week long, including at Laikunlava on Tuesday!


At 7:15 PM Elsi Sloan

Elsi Sloan is a young queer musician and actress with a soul that oozes tender and fragile, but fierce and poignant artpop. Singing loud and powerful, Elsi's lyrics recount experiences of identity construction, finding the subjective and universal truths of love, and the crises that have coloured her journey. Elsi will be joined on stage by drummer Vilho Louhivuori and bass artist Saara Mänttäri.



Accessibility information:

  • The grandstand has backless benches. The grandstand area is wheelchair accessible.
  • There is no induction loop on the Laikunlava stage.
  • The toilets at the Culture House Laikku are available until 8 PM. One toilet is accessible. The toilets are located on the 1st floor of Laikku, which is accessed from the end facing Laikunlava stage. Entry is by ringing the buzzer located at the door. The doorman opens the door remotely.

pages.name: Tampere Vocal Music Festival
pages.descriptionShort: Bringing together choirs and vocal ensembles, the Tampere Vocal Music Festival celebrates its 50th anniversary on 11–15 June 2025.
pages.descriptionLong:
Tampere Vocal Music Festival’s concerts present the stylistic spectrum of choral and ensemble music in a bold and open-minded way, without forgetting tradition and history. The free concert series is spread throughout the city, offering singing performances and community singing events for children, the elderly and the casual passer-by.


Over the three days (Thursday - Saturday), around 50 choirs will perform at the Choir Review, each for 15 minutes. The festival will culminate in the Chorus Review Gala on Sunday.


In the international Contest for Vocal Ensembles, vocal ensembles compete in acoustic and amplified categories. On Wednesday, all competitors will perform for 15 minutes. Winners will be announced at the Ensemble Contest Gala on Thursday.


The festival programme also includes workshops tailored above all for singers and conductors, as well as the Choir Forum in the lobby of Tampere Hall. The Choir Forum is the festival's common meeting place, where choral and vocal music lovers can meet, discuss and enjoy free events.

pages.name: Free rapid HIV and syphilis testing
pages.descriptionShort: Free rapid HIV and syphilis testing to all LGBTQIA+ people at the Sinuiksi ry office. Testing is organized by Sinuiksi ry and Hivpoint. You don't have to book an appointment to get tested.
pages.descriptionLong:
Sinuiksi ry and Hivpoint offer free rapid HIV and syphilis testing to all LGBTQIA+ people at the Sinuiksi ry office. You don't have to book an appointment.


HIV and syphilis testing is confidential. The rapid HIV and syphilis test is done by taking a small drop of blood from the fingertip. The result is ready in a minute. There is an opportunity to get advice for your own situation while testing.


It would be good to get tested for HIV and syphilis test if you have had unprotected sex with a casual partner. If you have used the same injection drug equipment with another person, it would be good to get tested for HIV.


Rapid HIV and syphilis test can be done three weeks after the exposure. For HIV, a negative test result is reliable when three months (12 weeks) or more have passed since the risk situation. For syphilis, a negative result is reliable six weeks after the risk situation.


A rapid HIV test can be done anonymously. Please note that a consent form must be filled out for the syphilis test. On the form, you enter your personal information and give permission to the disclosure of the necessary information so that your treatment can be arranged. Syphilis cannot be tested with a rapid test for people who have previously had syphilis.


All your health and personal information is confidential and protected.


Read more about accessibility: https://yhdistys.sinuiksi.fi/yhteystiedot/ohjeet-perille/

pages.name: Children's Art Workshops in Haihara
pages.descriptionShort: Art workshops for children on Wednesdays in June
pages.descriptionLong:
Children’s Art Workshops – Every Wednesday from June 4 to June 25, 2025, from 12 PM to 2 PM. Location: near the Pakari building at Haihara.


June 4 – Art from Natural Materials

We’ll gather sticks from the surroundings of Haihara and weave yarn around them. The resulting artworks can be used as decorations, for example, in a flower bed.


June 11 – Paper Doll

Create a paper doll that can be a human figure, animal, robot, or even an alien. We’ll also make clothes and other props for the character.


June 18 – Tree Spirit

We’ll sculpt a tree spirit from clay. You can take your figure home and attach it to a tree near your house, or we can place it on a tree near Haihara. Over the summer, you can observe how the artwork changes over time.


June 25 – Window/Door Decoration

We’ll make a paper house and glue natural flowers and plants into its translucent window opening.


Participation is free! Instructor: Paula Maunu / Children’s Cultural Center Rulla. Organized by the City of Tampere’s Public Cultural Services.
pages.imageAlt: A child's artwork is hanging on the window in front of a summery view.

pages.name: Nuorten Manse Pride: It's all about YOUth
pages.descriptionShort: On Wednesday, June 11, at the Youth Pride House there will be activities organized by young people and an art workshop!
pages.descriptionLong:
At the Youth Pride House on Wednesday 11.6.:


It's all about YOUth 🌟


i.e. activities produced by the youth themselves, an art workshop and as always, a chance to just chill and relax! At the Youth Council's (@nuorisovaltuutsto) booth from 4-7 pm you can test your knowledge of Pride flags, learn about the twists and turns of rainbow history and customize your own textiles with fabric dyes. Bring your own clothing to customize and make an impact with colors, words and symbols! We also have fabric scraps to use in customization!


The art workshop, organized in collaboration with Akaa Pride ry, will be about painting on the theme of Rainbow Utopia. The purpose of the workshop is to collect material for the Rainbow Utopia youth art exhibition to be held in Laaksola, Toijala, from 12 to 26 July 2025. Submitting your work is voluntary. All you need is clothes that you don't mind getting dirty, all other supplies are on site! What kind of world would you like to live in? Art workshop from 5-8 p.m.


The Youth Pride House is a meeting place for young people aged 13-25 who a part of the LGBTQI+ community and for those interested in the topics. The Youth Pride House is part of the Youth Manse Pride event week organized by the Youth Services of the City of Tampere. This year, Youth Pride House offers a different themed program for four days, but you can also just come and hang out. Youth Pride House is open during Manse Pride week from Tuesday to Friday and daily from 3–8 p.m. (except on Thursday, when it is extended until 10 p.m.). We follow the safer space guidelines in our activities. And as in previous years, the venue is the Youth Cultural Center, Monitoimitalo 13. Welcome!

In these turbulent times, it is important to show support for sexual and gender minorities. That is why we are celebrating the first Hirvipride this summer! All queers and allies are welcome. So come to Hirvitalo on June 11th at 3 pm to show your colors!

Programme:
3 pm RAINBOW PEACE DECLARATION
4 pm FREE SHOP STYLING WORKSHOP
5:30 pm FASHION SHOW
The workshop participants will present their creations. You can also ask a friend to present your work if you're too shy
6pm Likainen Hirvi

7pm TOVERI
The darkly energetic alternative rock of the solidary melanchlatter band Tover takes a stand and looks for silver linings in even the darkest clouds.
8pm THE EVENT ENDS

In addition you get to decorate your own Pride balloon, cut your own hair or ask a friend to do it with the clippers available on site at out gender affirming haircut station and of course enjoy a variety of vegan treats for a small payment.

pages.name: Lotta Maija concert at Saunatemple (Finnish sauna week)
pages.descriptionShort: At Lotta Maija's concert, your nerves will rest in the gentle embrace of music that awakens your inner peace. Her songs combine folklore and her own experience of connecting with nature.
pages.descriptionLong:
At Lotta Maija's concert, your nerves can rest in the gentle embrace of music that awakens inner peace of nature. Her songs combine folklore and her own experience of connection with nature. Some of the songs are in the rhythm of a poem and invite you to sing along!


Lotta Maija is a singer-songwriter who creates worlds through her music, taking the listener to her own nature. Her sunny and direct nature is conveyed in her songs. Authentic expression and the fact that the listener can rest in music are important to Lotta Maija. 


In addition to gigging, she holds singing circles, choirs, campfire guitar courses, poetry singing circles, flute lessons, various courses related to creativity and music making, and is recording her next album. Lotta Maija's debut album 'Tuulen Tytär' was released in 2022.


The gig is organized as a free event and Lotta Maija sings outside next to the Temple, sauna as usual 11€ per bather.


At the Sauna Temple, you can enjoy Lotta Maija's gig while swimming in the water, lounging on the rocks or lying on the sauna benches.


You can find Lotta Maija's music, social media and website here:


https://linktr.ee/lottamaijamusic

pages.name: Lempeä open mic
pages.descriptionShort: Lempeä open mic will be oozing queerness on Manse Pride-week! In this event you don't have to be queer in a pretty way, we'll make space for every thought and feeling regarding queerness and pride.
pages.descriptionLong:
Lempeä open mic will be oozing queerness on Manse Pride-week!

🫧

In this event you don’t have to be queer in a pretty way or be afraid of being too political, too fierce or too rough! We’ll make space for every thought and feeling regarding queerness and/or pride, whether it’s a soft whisper of self love or an angry speech of hopelessness, or anything in-between! We recommend this event for over 18-year-olds. So far our events have been finnish-speaking only, but for this event we’re broadening our horizons to any language you’d like to share with and hosting will be in finnish and english!

💫

Before the actual open mic there will be two opening acts: Hannaeerika and AARRE! The event is free of charge. As per usual, at the back of the space there will be pens and paper for the listeners who feel like doodling. There will be a keyboard on stage which you can use in your performance if you’d like. You can sign up to perform in advance at lempeaopenmic@gmail.com, but signing up will also be possible at the event. To start, we’re hoping for your set to be max 10mins. Please tell your stage name in your message.

🫧

Even though the event has a theme, you can share whatever you’d like. Our goal is to create a space for sharing especially for queer people. Openness to unfinished thoughts is still very important to us and we aim to keep the threshold to share as low as possible. Every performer will be met with open arms but we encourage you to check in with your own relationship to queerness and how and when to take and to give space.

🩷

See you next month, we are looking forward to this! 💫


Hannaeerika is a wonderful new name in the finnish indie music scene. She’s a singer-songwriter, whose gentle and playful style captures the listener from the very first note. Hannaeerika is an artist who believes in true self-expression. Her songs are full of personal stories and the small, meaningfull moments in life.


AARRE is a rapper and a transman. In his lyrics he covers his difficulties with men and manhood. The characters that have been hiding in the shadows will be released in front of the mic, it’s their time to come out

pages.name: MansePride Scrimmage
pages.descriptionShort: Welcome to watch the fast-paced roller derby at Kauppi Sports Center on Wednesday, June 11th starting at 7:30 PM!
pages.descriptionLong:
We offer the exhibition match to the public for free. The event starts at 7 pm with the team's on-skate warm-up, after which we will play the exhibition match starting at 7:30 pm. Tampere Roller Derby (TRD) is a roller derby club founded in 2009 and owned and operated by its members. TRD consists of the representative teams Tampere Roller Derby All-Stars and Tampere Howlin’ Rolls, amateurs Combat Wombats and officials. TRD plays at the highest domestic level in the roller derby championship. TRD's representative teams also tour abroad in games and tournaments. TRD wants to be a safe and meaningful space for everyone interested in roller derby to practice, develop and make friends. We do not accept any kind of racism, nor homophobia or transphobia within the club. Diversity is an asset and we respect the diversity of our members.


Additional information: The route to the event venue is barrier-free. The access route to the event venue is barrier-free. There is space for escort vehicles to park in front of the entrance. The event venue can be reached by public transport. There is an accessible parking space at the event venue. The entrance to the event venue is barrier-free and the entrance doors are automatic. Moving around the event venue is barrier-free. There is an accessible toilet in the event venue, which is marked with signs. The disabled toilet is gender-neutral. You can participate in the event with an assistant and/or guide dog. An induction loop is available at the event venue: unknown.

pages.name: Manse Pride knit graffiti in Sorsapuisto
pages.descriptionShort: Let's decorate the birch trees in Sorsapuisto with knitted graffiti in honor of Manse Pride week. Let's bring crafts to pride and pride to crafts.
pages.descriptionLong:
Welcome to join us for the environmental artwork!

Location: Sorsapuisto, Tampere, 12–19 June

Hanging day: Thu 12.6. 15-19

Dismantling: Thu 19.6. by 19


Organizer: Sinuiksi ry


Registration: by 8.6.



We will decorate the birch trees in Sorsapuisto with knitted graffiti in honor of Manse Pride week. We will bring crafts to pride and pride crafts. Tell us about your own craft group by participating in the event or show your skills by participating alone. If you wish, you can participate without your name being shared. Remember to register no later than 8.6. by using the form - early registration is appreciated.


When making knitted graffiti, the style is free. In addition to knitting, you can decorate the tree by crocheting, sewing, embroidery or felting. The trees have a circumference of 60–80 cm and the trunks are 150–180 cm long. For example, a 100 cm long knitted graffiti for a 60 cm trunk needs about 27 pieces of 15 cm granny squares. If you want to wrap an 80 cm tree trunk in a 20 cm wide striped scarf, the scarf should be 200 cm long so that it covers the trunk by about 50 cm. You can also do smaller works as long as the work reaches around the tree. 


We are organizing a hanging event on Thursday 12.6. from 3–7 pm, where everyone can bring their work and sew it onto the trees. You can dismantle your own work independently by 7 p.m. on Thursday, June 19. Otherwise, the work will be removed and possibly destroyed. Unfortunately, vandalism to the work is possible, and damaged work will not be replaced.


Fixing materials must not damage the trees in any way. Nothing may be screwed or nailed to the trees. Branches may not be cut. When dismantling the fastenings, care must be taken to ensure that no wires remain in the trees that could strangle the trees after the event.

pages.name: Film screening: For Boys (2024)
pages.descriptionShort: Tackling erotic taboos and spirituality, challenging societal norms of age and desire, For Boys tells the story of a dying photographer forced to confront his vanity in the face of affection.
pages.descriptionLong:
Tackling erotic taboos and spirituality, For Boys tells the story of a dying photographer forced to confront his vanity, as a deceived young man unexpectedly shows affection towards him, challenging societal norms of age and desire.


Mikael, facing his final days, craves validation and uses a false online identity to lure young men to his apartment, concealing his scarred face. When Paul arrives and expresses genuine affection, Mikael’s world of superficial connections is upended.


Caught in a nationwide lockdown, Mikael and Paul’s unexpected bond becomes a catalyst for surreal exploration of desires and vulnerabilities. As each day seamlessly blend together, Mikael and Paul journey through dreams and desires towards anguish and redemption.


Language: Finnish

Subtitles: English

Age limit: K12

Tickets: 11 € / Seta’s member organization members 9 €

pages.name: Youth Manse Pride: GRWM - Manse Pride 2025
pages.descriptionShort: On Friday, June 13th, we will be getting ready for the highlight of Manse Pride 2025: the march and the main party!
pages.descriptionLong:
At the Youth Pride House on June 13th:

💓 GRWM - Manse Pride 2025 💓

On Friday, we'll be getting ready for the highlight of Manse Pride week: the march and the main party 🩷 So come and make the final touches to your pride look!

15-20 | we'll be making different kind of jewelry from shrink plastic, painting fabric tags, making pearl bracelets and pins! Rewinding the week!

15-18 | there will be a traditional workshop where you can print and paint your own pride shirt! We have colors, stencils and white t-shirts in different sizes. You can bring your own cotton shirt with you if you want.

15-19 | sign workshop, where the materials needed to make signs are all provided!

The Youth Pride House is a meeting place for young people aged 13-25 who a part of the LGBTQI+ community and for those interested in the topics. The Youth Pride House is part of the Youth Manse Pride event week organized by the Youth Services of the City of Tampere. This year, Youth Pride House offers a different themed program for four days, but you can also just come and hang out. Youth Pride House is open during Manse Pride week from Tuesday to Friday and daily from 3–8 p.m. (except on Thursday, when it is extended until 10 p.m.).  We follow the safer space guidelines in our activities. And as in previous years, the venue is the Youth Cultural Center, Monitoimitalo 13. Welcome!

pages.name: Rainbow History Walk
pages.descriptionShort: In honor of Manse Pride Week, Sinuiksi ry is organizing two rainbow history-themed walks. The walks start at Laukontori. The walk lasts approximately 1.5 hours.
pages.descriptionLong:
In honor of Manse Pride Week, Sinuiksi ry is organizing two rainbow history-themed walks. The walks start on Tue 10.6. and Fri 13.6. at 6:00 PM from Laukontori. The walk lasts approximately 1.5 hours, ending at Otavalankatu. Participation in the walks is free of charge.


Welcome to the parade sites of Tampere's rainbow history to see and learn! We will follow the principles of a safer space at the event. You can read the principles in advance here: https://yhdistys.sinuiksi.fi/toiminta/turvallisempi-tila/


Accessibility of the venue and movement: The starting point Laukontori is accessible without barriers. The route follows the street network, on sidewalks and in park areas, as well as dirt roads/paths. There are no stairs along the route. There are traffic barriers at the street crossings, lowered at pedestrian crossings. In Hämeenpuisto, between Satamakatu and Kauppakatu, the route is uphill. Route: Laukontori – Satamakatu – Hämeenpuisto (park dirt road) – Kauppakatu – from Frenckell via the bridge to Koskipuisto (where there is also a dirt road) – Hatanpää highway – Otavalankatu.


Accessible parking space: There are some public accessible (streetside) parking spaces near the starting point Laukontori and the finishing point Otavalankatu, but their availability cannot be guaranteed. You can participate in the event with an assistant and/or guide dog. During the event tour, the speech will be announced via a portable loud speaker. The route mainly passes through smaller streets and parks, but there may be more traffic noise, especially in the Hämeenpuisto and Hatanpää highway areas.


You can ask Klaus for more information by email: klaus@sinuiksi.fi.

pages.descriptionLong: Welcome to bingo with Pirkanmaa's Green County Council group! This Green bingo will be held at Bar Kuja (Ratinankuja 1, Tampere) on Friday, June 13th 2025, starting at 6 pm. Everyone interested in politics, bingo and rainbow rights is welcome. 💚 The Greens are a party of the future and a social movement that brings together people from different backgrounds to change the world together. We defend nature and people against greed and shortsightedness. We want to ensure that everyone can live their own life, pursue the education they want and change the direction of their life, knowing that society's safety net will support them. For the Greens, equality and non-discrimination form the hard core of politics, which is not compromised on. Accessibility information: Bar Kuja is a step-free space located on one level. There is a wide ramp at the entrance. The bar's passageways are threshold-free corridors. There is an accessible toilet in the event space.

pages.name: Queer Spirituality
pages.descriptionShort: In honor of Manse Pride, a free evening for queer people interested in spirituality in Pesä. The program includes, among other things, a collective tarot reading.
pages.descriptionLong:
The program includes:

- thoughts on a more communal, queer spirituality 

- presentation of more inclusive tarot decks, including a few books on the subject

- a relaxed writing exercise to meet your own rainbow spirit guide or other helper

- collective tarot interpretation for participants

- a common final circle with the opportunity to share thoughts

 

For whom?

For anyone who finds the themes of our rainbow evening inviting.

Those attending the event commit to following the principles of a safer space principles.

 

When?

Fri 13.6. at 18.30-20.00.


Please register in advance according to the instructions below.


The evening will be organized if at least 6 participants register. Max. 15 participants can attend.


I will send all participants a confirmation on Wed 11.6. that the evening will take place - please check your email! Sometimes emails may end up in your spam or junk mail folder.

 

Where?

Pesä - Läsnäolon yhteisö offers us the space for the evening free of charge. Thank you Pesä! <3

Näsilinnankatu 28 E 5 inner courtyard, 3rd floor, 33200 Tampere

 

What to bring?

Comfortable clothes for sitting on the floor and a bottle of water and note-taking equipment if you wish. Tea and cookies available.

 

Accessibility and remote access:

Unfortunately, the space is not accessible. The space is on the third floor of a building without an elevator. The evening will be held in a yoga hall-type space, where we will sit in a circle on the floor. Platforms and a few chairs with backs will be available.


It is also possible to join the event remotely. The event will not be recorded. When registering, please choose whether you will attend in person or participate remotely.

 

Register like this:

"Buy" a place from this page. You will receive an order confirmation in your email, which will let you know that your registration has been received. When registering, please choose whether you will attend in person or participate remotely.


Please only register if you are sure you plan to participate. This way we will ensure that those who wish to participate can fit in and that there are no empty places unnecessarily. If you are unable to attend due to illness or other reasons, please kindly notify us by email at jenna@rohtomieli.fi

 

I will send all participants a confirmation on Wednesday 11.6. that the evening will take place - please check your email! Sometimes emails may end up in your spam or junk mail folder.

 

You are most welcome to join us!

Please tell a friend too :)

pages.name: LIVE-gigs / Kauris & Metsä-Annikki @ HAY Second Hand
pages.descriptionShort: HAY Second Hand is offering free live music experience as Kauris and Metsä-Annikki are playing their debut live gigs at the shop on Friday, June 13th
pages.descriptionLong:
HAY Second Hand is offering free live music experience as Kauris and Metsä-Annikki are playing their debut live gigs at the shop on Friday, June 13th. 


--


Kauris is playing sentimental sounds with Finnish lyrics, inspired from folk and dreampop music. 

Accoustic guitar playing with dreamy sound effects exploring the artist herself, relationships to others and surroinding world.

Behind Kauris is Anna Okkonen, who has been making music for few years, and on this live-gig her songs are heard as their original accoustic form. 

--

Metsä-Annikki, originally from the forests of mid-Finland, is a song-writer who discovered accoustic guitar as on 12-year-old. From the very begin, the guitar has helped her express herself on the hardest moments, and followed her in her greatest adventures. 

Metsä-Annikki is telling us stories from spaces between dream and awake, life and death. All wrapped up in images, in things that ultimately weren't even about it.

The journey takes you through the moss and ancient forest into the space. The songs will mostly be played as accoustic versions, and partly with synthetic sound effects involved. 



/////

Both of the artists are releasing their own music in the near future, and their music is played on live for the first time in HAY Second Hand gigs. 

19:00 Metsä-Annikki

20:00 Kauris

(Miikka Heikkinen on synthesizers)


FREE ENTRY


Welcome!

pages.name: Film screening: The Summer with Carmen (2023)
pages.descriptionShort: In a warm queer-comedy, two best friends spend time on the nudist beaches of Athens, brainstorming a screenplay about their relationship woes. A little dog called Carmen also gets mixed in the story!
pages.descriptionLong:
In this warm queer-comedy, two best friends spend time on the nudist beaches of Athens and brainstorm a screenplay about their relationship woes. A little dog called Carmen also gets involved in the story!

An astutely written and directed meta comedy about the nature of filmmaking, this Greek film playfully pokes fun at both itself and low-budget queer movies. Multiple layers of narrative feed together inventively to explore family relationships, friendships, romance, lust and even pet ownership for a group of 30-something guys. And as it knowingly grapples with issues of loyalty and masculinity, the film is warm, funny and very sexy. (Rich Cline, Shadows on the Wall)


Language: Greek

Subtitles: English

Age limit: K18

Tickets: 11 € / Seta’s member organization members 9 €

pages.descriptionShort: Come transgress with us at Sorsapuisto after the Manse Pride march! Anti-Art Drawing Club is hosting a pop-up art gallery featuring Protest banner art. Bring your sass, bring your silly.
pages.descriptionLong:

pages.name: Pride in Laikku: March Pre-Party
pages.descriptionShort: Celebration for Human Rights & Equity!
pages.descriptionLong:
Welcome to Culture House Laikku's Pride Pre-Party!

Stars of the event will be the fabulous Tampereen Kuningattaret drag group! Carrie, Tina the Balleriina and Aurora the Queen of Stars will perform in Lecture Hall at 12:30-13. You'll hear excerpts from their 'Kupliva Kesäkabaree' and 'Kolmas pyörä' shows. The queens will perform live, accompanied by pianist Olli Heikkinen.


In the Lecture Hall (2nd floor), from 11:00 to 13:30, there will be a sign-making workshop, a glitter station, and carnival accessory crafting, along with refreshments. Additionally, the art exhibitions (2nd and 3rd floors) and Laikku Café will be open.


The Children's Cultural Center Rulla will be open from 10:00. In Rulla's art workshop, flower decorations will be made from 10:00 to 16:00.


At 13:30, we will move to Keskustori to prepare for the march in which the city of Tampere is participating. The mayor's office will lead the parade, and the pride flags distributed by the city will convey a message of equality. Our 'Tampere For All' group offers an open and welcoming place in the parade for everyone who wants to participate – including those who do not have their own group or company.

pages.name: Flying Finn Tour - TamUA
pages.descriptionShort:
Tampere Sports Car Drivers and Flying Finn Tour.
Come and experience the excitement and community of motorsports at the open house.
pages.descriptionLong:
Tampere Motorsports and Flying Finn Tour.

Come and experience the excitement and community of motorsport at the open day.

This summer, 20 motorsports clubs around Finland are organizing Flying Finn Tour events, where you can get to know the fast-paced sport and the clubs' activities. Now is a great opportunity to get closer to motorsport than ever!

What's on offer?

- Children and young people aged 8-17 will be able to try out eMotorsport simulator driving under the guidance of coaches.

- There will also be various racing equipment on display in the yard area: rally car, jockey car, microcar, crosskart car, track car, etc.

– The club presents its activities and invites new enthusiasts to join

– Information for adults about various participation opportunities, you can also join the club.

Come along to learn, try out and get excited about motorsports!

—

The Flying Finn Tour is a sport presentation event supported by AKK-Motorsport ry and organized by clubs.

The goal of the Flying Finn Tour events is to inspire young people to get involved in motorsports and become members of the club.

pages.name: Plant dyed knit bag workshop
pages.descriptionShort: Welcome to join our plant dye + knitting workshop at Tampere Intercultural Art Space with natural dye artist Enni Heinä and fibre artist Riikka Peltola!
pages.descriptionLong:
What a treat we have in store for you!


Welcome to join our plant dye + knitting workshop at Tampere Intercultural Art Space with natural dye artist Enni Heinä and fibre artist Riikka Peltola! 


The aim of the workshop is to provide you with the skills and ideas how to combine natural dyeing and knitting techniques to create your own unique small knit bag.


WORKSHOP PROGRAMME


Sat 14.6: with Enni’s instructions we will dye recycled wool yarns with a selection of plants to create your own color palette 


Sun 15.6: Riikka will instruct a variety of knitting patterns and techniques to create your own bag. We will begin the knitting process in the workshop.


You can choose between three designs created by Riikka & Enni, or you can make your own variation based on the techniques used. We will guide you through the design process. 


All participants are provided with recycled wool yarn enough for a small sized tote bag or a zipper purse. There will be a selection of dye plants to choose your colors: browns, reds, yellows and olive greens.

The skill level of the workshop is beginner/basic. We wish that you are familiar with knit and purl stitches, flat knit and circular knit. Prior experience in natural dyeing is not needed. All the materials and equipment are provided. 


Where? Tampere Intercultural Art Space, Pirkankatu 10


When?14-15.6

Sat 11.00 - 15.00

Sun 11.00 - 14.00


Price: 95 EUR for two-day workshop


Languages FIN/ENG 


Registration required: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSenKni4q5jeKOrZU_XmNxmFYan6BaJo2-e7um03voAmvD1gwg/viewform

pages.name: Manse Pride march
pages.descriptionShort: Welcome to join us in marching for diversity and equality! Stronger together!
pages.descriptionLong:
Schedule and program

Saturday 14.6.2025

at 12.30 The gathering begins at the Central Market Square

The Mayor of Tampere declares a rainbow peace and Finlayson plays – Pelimannit entertains with their music

at 14 The march starts in front of the Town Hall

n. 3 pm We arrive at Sorsapuisto


Route

The march will start from in front of the Town Hall along the following route: Hämeenkatu – Rautatienkatu – Ronga underpass – Vellamonkatu – Tammelan puistokatu – Yliopistonkatu – Sorsapuisto

Route length

Approximately 1.7 km


Accessibility

The Central Market Square has cobblestones, in front of the Town Hall there is smoother paving and the tram tracks along Hämeenkatu and the road surface are paved, otherwise we will walk along a flat asphalt road. There is a long uphill section at the Ronga underpass. When you reach Sorsapuisto, the road turns into a dirt road.

There is a public, accessible toilet for the disabled in Keskustori next to Kirjastonpuisto.

You can participate in the procession with a guide dog or an assistant.

Advice and help 

Sinuiksi ry employees and volunteers will be there to help and advise. 

They can be identified by their pink vests with the Sinuiksi ry logo.

You can ask them for more information about organizing or other matters related to the march.


Instructions for participants


Arrival 

It is advisable to arrive well in advance of the march. 

You can reach Keskustori by bus on the 2, 4, 5, 7, 8A, 8B, 10, 30, 32, 40A, 40B, 40C, 50, 52A, 52B, 70, 80, 80, 82, 90, 93B and 93C. The nearest stops are Keskustori A-L. You can reach Keskustori by tram line 1 (Keskustori A and B stops are 40 meters apart). Please note that the march will affect public transport, causing possible changes to routes and schedules. Current information about public transport can be found at Nysse.fi.

Tampere Railway Station is located 750 meters away, and the bus station is 900 meters away. The Tampere passenger rail yard renovation may cause changes to train and transport connections at the railway station. Current travel information can be found at vr.fi/radalla/ratapiharemontti.


Organization

At the beginning of the march are the partner blocs and after them the blocs that have registered in advance and they organize themselves in front of the Town Hall in a guided manner. After the blocs, private individuals can join the joyful march. You can wait your turn, for example, in the parking area in front of the Old Church or in the adjacent Library Park.


March route 

Follow the route and maintain a unified and joyful atmosphere. 

Please follow the instructions of the volunteers and security guards for safety and smooth running. to ensure. 


MARCHIERS HAVE A DUTY TO AVOID EMERGENCY VEHICLES!

The march will be stopped in the event of a possible emergency vehicle.

Safety 

We will follow the principles of a safer space during the march. You can read the principles in advance here.

Take care of yourself and your fellow marchers. 

The march will proceed at walking pace. 

The security of the march is the responsibility of AiCan and, if possible, the police. Everyone must follow their instructions during the march. Sinuiksi ry volunteers are responsible for traffic control. 

In order for us to get through the city safely and peacefully, this requires cooperation from the march participants. If you experience or see inappropriate behavior or other threatening activity during or before the parade, report it immediately to the security guards, Sinuiksi ry volunteers or the police! 

Fire, smoke, flares and other dangerous objects and substances are strictly prohibited during the parade. We also do not accept violent or inappropriate behavior.

pages.name: Selkie – The Seal Woman
pages.descriptionShort: Selkie – The Seal Woman features two stories about crossing boundaries, about corrective action, about understanding, about accepting reality and, finally, about forgiveness.
pages.descriptionLong:
Ruamjai choir's performance Selkie – The Seal Woman features two stories about crossing boundaries, about corrective action, about understanding, about accepting reality and, finally, about forgiveness.


The underlying narrative is an ancient tale from the shores of the northern ocean. A fisherman in the cold north sees silver-speckled seal women dancing on a rock at night. He steals one of the seal pelts and thus captures one of the selkies to be his wife. He promises to give back her seal pelt when seven summers have passed. The couple have a son, Ooruk, who despite his father’s protestations eventually helps his mother return to the sea and thus learns the connection between the two worlds.


Interspersed with this tale are composer Tellu Turkka’s own diary entries from the period 2011–2018 about her devastating divorce and struggle to survive a serious illness. The work has nine movements and a duration of about 60 minutes.


Admission is free, but pre-registration is required. Pre-registration will open in May.

Tantra belongs to everybody!


Learn a tantric hug! Bring a friend or hug me, I'll teach you the tantric way. Meet me during Manse Pride 2025 main celebration in Sorsapuisto, on Saturday, June 14. I will be at Kaleva end of the park with a Silja Helinä- Queer tantra banner. Free of charge.


The park is an accessible space and open to everyone. You can arrive on foot, by car, or using public transportation. The event is also suitable for children and youth.


Your teacher:

Silja Helinä is a tantrapreneur, mental coach and health care professional based in Tampere. She is a Manse Pride 2025 partner and a member of We Speak Gay-community. She has a passion for guiding individuals on a journey of self-discovery and connection.


Drawing from her extensive experience in mental coaching, midwifery and tantra, she creates transformative experiences for individuals and couples, especially within the LGBTQ+ community.


Silja's work is rooted in promoting equality, inclusion, and sustainability, offering safe and playful spaces for people to explore their bodies, boundaries, and relationships. 


Silja believes in the power of authentic connection and playful exploration as a means to create a more fulfilled, balanced, and joyful life.
pages.imageAlt: People hugging on Pride day. Logos of Manse Pride and Silja Helinä attached.

pages.name: Manse Pride 2025 main celebration
pages.descriptionShort: The main Manse Pride party will be held this year in Sorsapuisto, traditionally. There will be lots of fun and great performances.
pages.descriptionLong:
We warmly welcome everyone to celebrate the Manse Pride main party with us at Sorsapuisto on Saturday 14.6. The rainbow-colored main party of good cheer will start at approximately 15:10, immediately after the march has arrived at Sorsapuisto.


The main party will follow the principles of a safer space, which you can read about here: https://thl.fi/aankohtaista/tapahtumat/turvallisempien-tapahtumien-priyaatteet-thl-ssa.


SCHEDULE


The park party will be held on 14.6. between 3 and 6 p.m.


The program will be finalized during the spring.


ARRIVAL


Sorsapuisto can be reached by bus on routes 2, 6, 7, 9, 19, 27, 29, 40A/B/C, 42, 90X and 95. The nearest stops are Tampere-talo (100 meters), Sorsapuisto (250 meters), Yliopisto A (350 meters) and Yliopisto D (400 meters). The tram stop for lines 3 and 1 is located 250 meters away. Tampere Railway Station is located 600 meters away. Tampere Bus Station is located 1 kilometer away.


Please note that the march will affect public transport, causing possible route and schedule changes. Current information about public transport can be found at www.nysse.fi.


ACCESSIBILITY


Arrival: There is a small escorted traffic area in the courtyard of Tampere Hall. The nearest disabled parking space for a passenger car is located on Lähteenkatu (more than 25 meters). The nearest bus stop is 100 meters away. Event location: The event location is accessible. The event area is located outdoors, so the terrain may be uneven in places. The stages and tents are located on a grassy area and are surrounded by dirt roads. There is also an accessible, gender-neutral public toilet in the area. You can participate in the event with an assistant and a guide dog. The performances will include music and speech. There are no subtitles or sign language interpretation available.


SECURITY


AiCan is responsible for the security of the park festival, and they can be identified by their high-visibility vests with the words “Sjärjestysenvalvoja” on the back. There is a SPR first aid station in the park. Sinuiksi ry employees can be identified by their pink high-visibility vests with the Sinuiksi ry logo on the back.


The harassment contact person for the main festival is Mico Ylimäki (040 510 7488) mico.ylimaki@pirkanmaanseta.fi


VENUE


The Tampere Hall toilets are available for use by visitors to the park festival. Sinuiksi ry staff and volunteers will direct you there if necessary. In addition, 1 accessible public toilet can be found in the Sorsapuisto.


We hope that each participant will dispose of their own trash properly. This will greatly facilitate the work of our cleaning team. There are numerous trash cans in Sorsapuisto that can be used freely.


The theme of the celebration is "One big family". You can and should be visible on social media,

so share photos of your participation by tagging @mansepride and using the hashtags #mansepride and #yhtäsuurtaperhettä


Welcome to celebrate Manse Pride 2025 as one big family!

pages.descriptionShort: Enjoy the end of Pride Week with good food and a feel-good movie at Tuulensuu Palace
pages.descriptionLong:
Sun 15.6. at 11.30 Ihmemaa Oz - The Wizard of Oz, 1939, K7, duration 1 h 42 min

Movie brunch €36

Movie brunch with Sinuiiksi Ry membership card €29. Membership card entitling to discount must be presented on site.

Children up to 12 years old accompanied by an adult €19 (no separate ticket product)


Tuulensuu Palatsi's Movie brunch includes a delicious spread of locally produced delicacies. The film is shown as an additional program free of charge.

Please note the age limit of the film shown at the brunch! The age limit can be relaxed by 3 years under the responsibility of an adult accompanying the child to dinner.


Setting at 11:30. Doors open at 11. Please arrive on time so that you have time to shop at the counter and be shown to your table.

We recommend purchasing Movie Brunches and Dinners set menus in advance from our online store. Please note that pre-sale in the online store ends at 6 pm the day before the event.


After a successful online store purchase, you will receive an order confirmation for the catering service by email. Present the order confirmation to the Tuulensuun Palatsi staff electronically from your phone screen or as a paper printout.

If the event has already been removed from online sales, you can inquire about the last-minute situation by email at ravintola@tuulensuunpalatsi.fi. Please include your name and the number of members in your party in the message. The restaurant will confirm whether there are any available seats for the desired setting. Pay for your reserved meals to the restaurant staff upon arrival.

You can also book and purchase Leffa Brunch or Dinner on the same day on site at Tuulensuu Palatsi, if there are still places available.


Menu:

Additional information on meals and other special diet notifications: ravintola@tuulensuunpalatsi.fi


Changes possible.


Production Tuulensuun Palatsi Restaurants & Tampere Live in collaboration with Manse Pride


ACCESSIBILITY


Tuulensuu Palace is a listed building that is protected by the Finnish National Board of Antiquities. For this reason, the building is not completely accessible, but we are constantly working to ensure that all our customers have the opportunity to enjoy our events and activities as accessible and adapted as possible.


Customers with disabilities:

Tuulensuu Palace has taken the needs of customers with disabilities into account as much as possible. It is possible to install a ramp at the main door, which allows for barrier-free access to the first floor with a wheelchair or electric wheelchair. The ramp is designed to withstand high weights (300 kg), ensuring safe and smooth movement.



Accessible movement on the first floor:

The first floor is generally accessible. The restaurant and conference rooms on the floor are all accessible without obstacles, and an accessible toilet can be found near the entrance hall.


Sensory accessibility:

Tuulensuu Palatsi also takes sensory limitations into account. There is an induction loop on the ground floor, which improves the opportunities for our hearing-impaired customers to enjoy events and hear presentations, speakers or other sounds more clearly and easily.


Customer service and assistance:

Our staff is trained to assist customers with mobility and sensory limitations. If you know in advance that you will need assistance upon arrival, you can let us know in advance and we will do our best to make your visit as smooth as possible. You can contact us by email, for example, at ravintola@tuulensuunpalatsi.fi, and we will ensure that the service is tailored to your needs.


Our goal is to continuously improve accessibility and develop our facilities so that they serve all our customers equally. Accessibility is an important part of our corporate social responsibility, and we are committed to ensuring that Tuulensuun Palatsi is as accessible as possible for everyone.

pages.name: Whisking Sunday (Finnish Sauna Week)
pages.descriptionShort: During the summer, Saunatemppeli offers three unique opportunities to experience the deepest essence of Finnish sauna culture – soft steam baths and traditional vihta treatment.
pages.descriptionLong:
F I H D O N T - S U N D A I


F Ihdonta-Sundays in the summer once a month from 12-16


SUNDAYS


15.6. //  6.7. //  17.8.

12-4 PM


Let the sauna relax you

Let the troubles melt away


Vihta treatment day – An experience in the rhythm of nature


Welcome to stop in the midst of everyday hustle and bustle and pamper your body and mind with traditional vihta treatment!


Saunatemppeli offers three unique opportunities during the summer to experience the deepest essence of Finnish sauna culture – soft saunas and vihta treatment based on traditional knowledge.


Each treatment is made according to the customer's wishes and needs with local natural products. It is suitable for everyone. Two sauna guests can take part at a time - come with a friend or on your own! The finale lasts about 45 minutes with breaks, before and after the finale there is an opportunity to lounge on the stage for a while. Reservations from the online store, link in bio.


Vihta treatment is not just a vihto – it is a ritual that cleanses, revitalizes and returns your body to its natural rhythm. Vihtonta stimulates the metabolism, deeply relaxes the muscles and effectively reduces pain. The heat and silence of the sauna relax the nervous system and help with recovery.


The vihtonta are trained traditional sauna user Juha from Saunatemppeli and yoga teacher and beekeeper Katariina Kotarova, who learned her lessons at Sipoonjoki Traditional Sauna.


VIHTONTA TREATMENT BOOKINGS FROM THE ONLINE STORE:

https://saunakonkeli.johku.com/fi_FI/saunakonkeli/vihdontasunnuntai
