pages.name: Guided tour of the Old City Hall
pages.descriptionShort: Discover the history of the Old City Hall on a guided tour - sign up now!
pages.descriptionLong:
Tampere Old City Hall opens its doors this year with free guided tours. The first tour will take place on 27 January 2025, and you can sign up using the link below. The tours of the Old City Hall will celebrate the 150th anniversary of Tampere City Council and city democracy. The tours will be held in Finnish, but you can ask the guides questions in English during the tour. 


This year marks the 150th anniversary of the establishment of Tampere City Council. To celebrate, the City of Tampere is offering free guided tours of the historic Tampere Old City Hall. 


The tours, led by Tampere Tourist Guides, will give you an insight into the history of the Neo-Renaissance building, completed in 1890, and the many stories behind it. The tours are conducted in Finnish, but you can ask questions in English during the tour.  


The first tour will take place on Monday 27 January 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm. You can sign up for the tour by clicking on the Eventila link at the end of this news item. There is a capacity of 25 people and places will be filled on a first-come, first-served basis. 


The guided tours will take place once a month. There will be a separate registration link for each tour, which will open approximately three weeks before the tour. The registration links will be updated in the Tampere event calendar announcement.


Old City Hall tours in 2025


  • Mon 27 January 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 24 February 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 17 March 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 14 April 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 19 May 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 16 June 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 25 August 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 22 September 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 13 October 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 17 November 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm
  • Mon 15 December 2025 from 5 pm to 6 pm


Please note that studded shoes are not allowed in the Old City Hall.

At 6.30 PM Kanerva-kuoro

Tampere Kanerva-kuoro ("Kanerva Choir") is a four-part mixed choir founded in 1945. The choir is open to singing enthusiasts of all ages and levels, inviting them to experience the joy of singing together with a low threshold. In addition to our own concerts, an important mission is to bring the joy, emotions, and memories of singing to places like nursing homes. Our repertoire mainly consists of Finnish and Slavic songs. pages.name: Rakas Tampere: Shopping throughout the ages guided tour IN FINNISH
pages.descriptionShort: Rakas Tampere: Trade through the ages guided tours (IN FINNISH) tell the story of Tampere's trade and merchants, as well as a little bit of the present day. The guided tour is free of charge.
pages.descriptionLong:
Do you know what Tampere's main street used to be, how money was transported in Tirkkonen's shop, where Laukontori got its name and how many bricks were used to build the Market Hall?


Dear Tampere: Trade through the ages -guided tours tell the history of Tampere's trade and merchants and a little bit of the present day on summer Tuesdays for eight weeks. The guided tour is IN FINNISH and completely free of charge for participants. The Tampere Tunnetuksi ry provides guidance for participants. 


The guided tour by Tampere tourist guides lasts 90 minutes. The tour departs from Laukontori and during the guided tour you will visit both Tampere's Market Hall and the Market Square. The tour ends at Tampere Central Market. The tour will cover a distance of about a kilometer at a leisurely pace and will climb a few stairs.


NOTE! The tour is in Finnish.

The guided tours leave from below the Laukontori clock.

pages.name: Relaxing sound journey
pages.descriptionShort: Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group audio tour on Tue 17.6.25 from 19:15-20:30 to the Pirtti, a historic building built in 1861 in the Niemenranta area.
pages.descriptionLong:
Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group sound journey on Tue 17.6.25 at 19.15-20.30 to the Pirtti, built in 1861 and full of history in the Niemenranta area.


The Pirtti is located in Lielahti next to the magnificent cattle building designed by Birger Federley. The Pirtti has been renovated and its outer walls have also regained their original yellow color.


Inside the Pirtti, there is a wonderfully serene atmosphere and the beautiful log walls and wooden floor provide a wonderful setting for a sound bowl concert.


The Pirtti has excellent transport connections to and from Tampere. For example, the journey from Pyynikintori takes approx. 10 minutes by tram and the walk from the tram stop to the Pirtti is approx. 400m.


The singing bowl concert takes you on a sound journey, where in addition to singing bowls, many other therapeutic instruments play. A relaxing sound journey is a healing experience that offers the mind and body a moment of rest in the midst of hectic everyday life.

At the end of the evening, it is wonderful to head home relaxed and prepare for sleep.


This evening, the main instruments are traditional Tibetan singing bowls 🎶

in addition to which the sound world is enlivened by many other therapeutic instruments.


For an hour, you can lie under a blanket with your eyes closed and just relax, listening to the harmony and vibration of the bowls. Breathing becomes more even and deeper, heart rate decreases and mind calms down.


Take time for yourself ♥️


Bring your own platform (yoga mat, camping mattress, sun lounger cushion), pillow and blanket. The harmony bath is received comfortably lying under a blanket, you can also sit if you wish. You can borrow a yoga mat, let us know in the registration message if you need it. Dress in comfortable and relaxed clothes, also bring some warm clothes, because when the body relaxes it often gets cold. Remember to also bring a water bottle. At the beginning and end, there is a moment of time reserved for conversation, clinking glasses for approx. 60 min.


Price: €22 incl. VAT

Payment on site in cash or MobilePay on the day of the event at. By 15


REGISTRATION

infohealingtones@gmail.com

(registration is binding)


You will receive instructions on how to arrive by return mail and it is also a confirmation that your registration has arrived. If you do not receive a return email, please check if the email address is spelled correctly.


More information about events and upcoming events:

www.healingtones.fi

(events also in Kangasala, Lempäälä, Pirkkala and Ylöjärvi)


See you at Rientola Pirtti ✨

pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:

At 6 PM Anton V. Kivi
Anton V. Kivi is a new singer-songwriter from Tampere, performing stripped-down, dark-toned indie folk. His music centers around minimalist arrangements built around acoustic guitar and captivating vocal interpretations, along with thought-provoking lyrics. In his songs, Anton V. Kivi addresses the unspoken pain points of humanity and societal themes such as the climate crisis and criticism of capitalism. The intimate atmosphere of the songs compels the listener to consciously focus on the music and reflect on the topics raised. The artist's debut single ”Huhtikuu (kukaan ei puhu siitä)” is the first release from his debut EP, which will be released in the fall of 2025.

pages.name: Summer Park Concerts: Papa Reino & Hurja-Jussi
pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. The concerts at Haihara are held in Valjasvaja.

At 6 PM Papa Reino & Hurja-Jussi
Rising from the mist of the marsh and the soil of rocky fields, Härmälä blues mystic Papa Reino performs Finnish-sung blues-folk with his cigar box guitar. Papa Reino's music strongly reflects the influences of American delta blues and roots music. His second album, Hiljaiset hautajaiset, was released in September 2024. In the Summer Park Concert, Papa Reino performs as a duo with master violinist Hurja-Jussi.

See you in Tampere Summer Park Concerts!

pages.name: Summer Park Concerts: Bad Vision, Perhana plays Nirvana, Soundrun
pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. 

At 6 PM Bad Vision
Bad Vision from Tampere turns even everyday topics into rocking tunes and powerful anthems.

At 7 PM Perhana plays Nirvana
Perhana plays Nirvana is a tribute band from Tampere that performs Nirvana's music with high energy and respect for the original. The band has been active since 2021. At their gigs, the atmosphere is electric, and the band gives their all every time. Grunge is not dead!

At 8 PM Soundrun
Soundrun is a rock band whose music is influenced by hard rock, blues rock, and punk rock. Their gigs mostly feature the band's own material, but they also select a few carefully chosen and less commonly heard cover songs for their performances.

See you in Tampere Summer Park Concerts!

pages.name: Summer Park Concerts: Lempivärit, Jäätelökone
pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. 

At 6 PM Lempivärit
Lempivärit enchants, touches, and entertains with their atmospheric gigs. The band uniquely combines diverse music with personal lyrics that address equality and environmental and climate crises. In Lempivärit's rocking indie folk, the viola and woodwinds illustrate the twists of Finnish-language songs, complemented by the ukulele bass, guitar/banjo, and drums. However, the songs escape genre boundaries, taking the listener to surprising places and moods. In the summer of 2024, Lempivärit released their debut album, “Tehkää jotakin!”. Musically, Lempivärit follows its own progressive paths on the album. The lyrics take a broad stance while maintaining a twinkle in the eye.

At 7 PM Jäätelökone
Jäätelökone plays self-made folk-inspired pop music! The core elements of our songs are distinctive lyrics, changing moods, and thought-provoking tones. Our live set is performed with a cajon-based drum kit, guitar, bass, and keyboards, with vocal harmonies playing a crucial role. Join us in daydreaming or sing along!

See you in Tampere Summer Park Concerts!

pages.name: THE NEUEN SÄCHSISHEN GALLERIE´S GRAPIC ART BIENNAL: FIRE, FIRE
pages.descriptionShort: The theme of the biennial is FIRE, FIRE.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Neue Sächsische Galerie's graphic art biennial is travelling during the Capital of Culture year of Chemnitz. Thanks to a cooperation with the German Cultural Centre and the municipal Laikku Galleria in Tampere, we are presenting our flagship project at a hotspot of the Finnish graphic art scene.

 

The theme of the biennial is FIRE, FIRE!

The fire is burning brightly and everyone is gradually realising how hot it is getting under their soles. We can no longer escape the conflicts of the world, we have to develop attitudes and gradually make serious adjustments to our actions. The challenges are lurking around every corner, even for us people who are used to peace. The good future can no longer be bought with money alone. Indifference is not yet punished, aeroplanes still fly and cars still drive at will. There are still living trees in our city centres. But those who can see can sense the impositions to come. They are likely to be painful. They will claim victims, always according to the thickness of their wallets. We are playing with fire.

 

This year's Graphic Arts Biennale also wants to draw attention to increasingly inflammatory and aggressively escalating processes in social interaction. Parallel to the fatal treatment of nature, social disputes in the present day are leading ever more quickly to increasingly harsh confrontations. Statements replace dialogues. The search for common ground is becoming more difficult. Culture is becoming more important as a space for discourse and thus solutions. As a non-verbal source of inspiration, art can help to overcome speechlessness and find common ground with its less worn-out visual language.

 

Professional artists in Saxony were asked to submit current works. As a result of the competition with a jury decision from 355 submitted works, the exhibition of 100 works was created. Award winners are: Kai Spade, Bettina Haller, Stephanie Marx, Stefan Knechtel, Juana Anzellini, Susanne Werdin

 

Even if printmaking leads a marginalised existence due to its relatively minor importance on the art market, this biennial impressively demonstrates the inventive character of this diverse world. Thanks to the great commitment of workshops and printers in all three major Saxon cities, traditional techniques are being realised to the highest quality and the joy of experimenting with the new, mixing techniques and completely new applications of the developing technological possibilities knows no bounds. This seems to be the future of printmaking. On the other hand, this exhibition is a fascinating demonstration of what can still be achieved by limiting oneself to simple techniques such as lino printing. Statistically speaking, a renaissance of classic techniques can be observed. Linocut became the most widely used printing technique for the first time this year. Its ease of use, even without a printing workshop, also points to the precarious situation of many artists. The support materials are becoming more diverse and image creation is increasingly based on photographic impulses. Digital techniques remain in the background. They are not yet developing the creative powers we are looking for.

 

Exhibition at Kulttuuritalo Laikku Galleria, Keskustori 4, Tampere.

Open Tue – Sat 10am – 6pm. Free admission.


For more information about the exhibitions at Kulttuuritalo Laikku:

Irma Puttonen

Leading coordinator

irma.puttonen@tampere.fi

+358 50 553 8673

City of Tampere, City Culture Unit

pages.name: Hiedanranta - A city district of the future full of history
pages.descriptionShort: Guided walking tours are organized in Hiedanranta on summer Saturdays.
pages.descriptionLong:
Come and explore Hiedanranta – a city district where fascinating industrial heritage meets a new kind of urban life. A guided tour will give you a glimpse into the manor’s history, the factory environment and other historical buildings in the area, as well as how they relate to future plans.


A new and communal city district is being built in Hiedanranta, home to around 20,000 people. Here, environmentally friendly solutions and a new block where culture, nature and everyday life are in balance will be created.


Admission to the walking tours is free.


The tours are in Finnish.


The tours are organised by Hiedanrannan Kehitys Oy in collaboration with Magni Mundi and the Tampereen Matkaoppaat ry.

pages.name: Relaxing sound journey
pages.descriptionShort: Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group audio tour on Tue 17.6.25 from 19:15-20:30 to the Pirtti, a historic building built in 1861 in the Niemenranta area.
pages.descriptionLong:
Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group sound journey on Tue 17.6.25 at 19.15-20.30 to the Pirtti, built in 1861 and full of history in the Niemenranta area.


The Pirtti is located in Lielahti next to the magnificent cattle building designed by Birger Federley. The Pirtti has been renovated and its outer walls have also regained their original yellow color.


Inside the Pirtti, there is a wonderfully serene atmosphere and the beautiful log walls and wooden floor provide a wonderful setting for a sound bowl concert.


The Pirtti has excellent transport connections to and from Tampere. For example, the journey from Pyynikintori takes approx. 10 minutes by tram and the walk from the tram stop to the Pirtti is approx. 400m.


The singing bowl concert takes you on a sound journey, where in addition to singing bowls, many other therapeutic instruments play. A relaxing sound journey is a healing experience that offers the mind and body a moment of rest in the midst of hectic everyday life.

At the end of the evening, it is wonderful to head home relaxed and prepare for sleep.


This evening, the main instruments are traditional Tibetan singing bowls 🎶

in addition to which the sound world is enlivened by many other therapeutic instruments.


For an hour, you can lie under a blanket with your eyes closed and just relax, listening to the harmony and vibration of the bowls. Breathing becomes more even and deeper, heart rate decreases and mind calms down.


Take time for yourself ♥️


Bring your own platform (yoga mat, camping mattress, sun lounger cushion), pillow and blanket. The harmony bath is received comfortably lying under a blanket, you can also sit if you wish. You can borrow a yoga mat, let us know in the registration message if you need it. Dress in comfortable and relaxed clothes, also bring some warm clothes, because when the body relaxes it often gets cold. Remember to also bring a water bottle. At the beginning and end, there is a moment of time reserved for conversation, clinking glasses for approx. 60 min.


Price: €22 incl. VAT

Payment on site in cash or MobilePay on the day of the event at. By 15


REGISTRATION

infohealingtones@gmail.com

(registration is binding)


You will receive instructions on how to arrive by return mail and it is also a confirmation that your registration has arrived. If you do not receive a return email, please check if the email address is spelled correctly.


More information about events and upcoming events:

www.healingtones.fi

(events also in Kangasala, Lempäälä, Pirkkala and Ylöjärvi)


See you at Rientola Pirtti ✨

<3:t Terhi Jaskari


*All rights reserved.

pages.name: Haihara Summer Wednesdays
pages.descriptionShort: Art workshop, outdoor flea market and concert
pages.descriptionLong:
Every Wednesday from July 2 to July 30, 2025, from 3 PM to 7 PM

3 PM - 5 PM Art Workshops in front of Haihara Manor. In case of rain, held in Valjasvaja.

3 PM - 6 PM Outdoor Flea Market in front of Haihara Manor. Not held in rainy weather.

6 PM - 7 PM Summer Park Concerts in Valjasvaja (no concert on July 30).


2.7. Theatre in the Park Come and try the basics of acting through fun and relaxed exercises. In the workshop, we will create our own 'Play of the Day' using the Forum Theatre method. The instructor is Miia Säppi / Tampere Intercultural Art.


9.7. & 16.7. Photography workshop The workshop invites participants to explore new approaches to photography. The session includes a one-hour walk in the local environment, focusing on photography using a theme, natural materials, reflections, and physical movement. No prior photography experience is required, just a curious mind! Participants can use any type of camera—smartphone, digital, film, or DSLR. Instructor of the workshop is Daria Craciun / Tampere Intercultural Art.


23.7. & 30.7. Art Orienteering In the art orienteering workshop, participants are given tasks and clues that help them explore the Haihara Art Center’s exhibitions and their themes on a deeper level. The orienteering takes place both inside the exhibition spaces and outside in the nearby environment. The workshop opens up new perspectives on viewing and experiencing art. The art orienteering is led by Zeynep Kaynar / Tampere Intercultural Art.


No prior registration is required for the workshops. Participants of all ages are welcome, small children accompanied by an adult. None of the workshops require previous experience. Come and boldly try something new! The workshops are conducted in easy Finnish and English.


Outdoor Flea Market is open for everyone and selling spots are free of charge. Welcome to sell or find second-hand gems!


Summer Park Concerts in July, in Haihara:

2.7. Raija & Toonika

9.7. Amilos

16.7. Duo Pamela & Piia Kristiina

23.7. Pirkkalan Pelimannit

Check the whole schedule for the summer: puistokonsertit.fi/en


The art exhibitions in the Haihara Manor and the Stable are open on Wednesdays from 1 PM to 6 PM. Runeberg’s Cottage is open from 12 PM to 6 PM, and Haihara’s Coffee Chamber from 12 PM to 7 PM.

pages.name: Summer Park Concerts: Solar Blue, SaintPolis, HAKA
pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. 

At 6 PM Solar Blue
A versatile swing band. We play relaxed blues with a feel-good vibe, as well as jazzy and rocking groove-based music.

At 7 PM SaintPolis
Rapidly rising to the forefront of Finnish American rock, Tampere-based SaintPolis weaves elements of Americana, folk, and indie rock into their musical tapestry. The band released their highly anticipated second album, Hope Comes in Like the Waves, in January 2025. Desibeli described it in their four-star review as follows: “Everything has a sense of life, real weight, and depth”, “The band sounds positively international, with four-part harmonies crowning the whole.” SaintPolis's widely acclaimed debut album, Gears of the Heart Change, was released in early 2023.

At 8 PM HAKA
HAKA is a rock band founded in Tampere. We've been playing together for several years, and everything works smoothly. Our songs describe various emotions and things in a cryptic, poetic way. The vibes are guaranteed!

See you in Tampere Summer Park Concerts!

pages.name: Art Walk
pages.descriptionShort: TIcAS Art Walk is a relaxed guided tour that focuses on art one may view while being out and about. Statues, architecture and even street art, all catered with lil' nuggets of historical information.
pages.descriptionLong: Have you ever roamed the streets of Tampere, come across some piece of art and thought to yourself: “Huh, I wonder what this is”? Well, maybe this is your chance to get some answers! TIcAS Art Walk is quite literally a walk that focuses on art one may view while being out and about in the city. Statues, architecture and even street art, all catered with lil’ nuggets of historical information and anecdotes, delivered to you by TIcAS member Miia Säppi. This is a free event, but requires registration. Please sign up through the attached link. This activity is supported by City of Tampere.

Vartin Yli is a cover band that mainly plays pop/rock hits by female singers from different decades in Finnish and English. Their setlist includes songs by Irina, Behm, Haloo Helsinki, Scandinavian Music Group, and others. pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere.


At 6 PM The Jack Flash Band

The Jack Flash Band, a six-member Rolling Stones tribute band from Tampere, plays all the classics and a bunch of lesser-known gems from the seventies. Come join us for an enjoyable time with rock, blues, and country music, singing and dancing along.


At 7 PM LEVELLING THE LAND

Levelling the Land performs music by the English folk-punk band The Levellers. Leading the band is Brit Colin Hartley.


At 8 PM Daniela Lila

Daniela Lila is a rock band from Tampere, founded in 2023. Their music draws from punk, grunge, post-punk, gothic rock, noise rock, and more - yet the band clearly doesn't fit neatly into any one of these genres. The expression is fierce and intense, the guitar playing is raw and simple, the bass paints textures throughout the songs, and the drums are constantly in overdrive.

pages.name: Nokia Pride park party and procession
pages.descriptionShort: Nokia Pride is coming again! this years Nokia Pride -week is celebrated in week 28 and it culminates on saturday 12th of July as park party and procession!
pages.descriptionLong:
The Nokia Pride park party is being celebrated for the fifth time this year! Nokia Pride is a rainbow-themed event in the heart of Nokia, Poutunpuisto. The party starts at 2 pm with a parade leaving the park (the parade starts at around 1:45 pm), which will tour the center of Nokia and return to the park well in advance of the program with speakers and performers starting at 3 pm! The park party will be celebrated with a picnic, enjoying the rainbow-themed program and exploring the stalls and offerings of the partners present. It is worth booking your own picnic blanket and a cheerful spirit! You can bring your own picnic snacks or buy them from the Vegaaniliitto stall. The event lasts about a couple of hours.


The party is a free event for the whole family. We follow the principles of a safer space in all our events, which you can read in advance on our website (unfortunately only in Finnish)!
pages.imageAlt: Photo from Nokia Pride procession in 2024, in front of the picture the board of Nokia Pride association holding a big banderole with their logo on it.

pages.name: Nokia Pride evening party for adults 2025
pages.descriptionShort: The Nokia Pride evening party for adults will be held at the Korjaamo hall in Tehdassaari.
pages.descriptionLong:
Nokia Pride week culminates in a great adult evening party (K-18) when we fill the Tehdassaari Korjaamo hall with rainbow colors and bubbling queer energy! This party will feature both amazing performers from drag to erotic dance, and the hottest rainbow hits of the last decades provided by our amazing DJ! Welcome to celebrate the most colorful party of the year!


The party is K-18 and admission costs 10 euros. At all our events, we follow our safer space principles, which you can read in advance on our website!

pages.name: Relaxing sound journey
pages.descriptionShort: Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group audio tour on Tue 15.7.25 from 19:15-20:30 to the Pirtti, a historic building built in 1861 in the Niemenranta area.
pages.descriptionLong:
Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group sound journey on Tue 15.7.25 at 19.15-20.30 to the Pirtti, a historic building built in 1861 in the Niemenranta area.


The Pirtti is located in Lielahti next to the magnificent cattle building designed by Birger Federley. The Pirtti has been renovated and its outer walls have also regained their original yellow color.


Inside the Pirtti, there is a wonderfully serene atmosphere and the beautiful log walls and wooden floor provide a wonderful setting for a sound bowl concert.


The Pirtti has excellent transport connections to and from Tampere. For example, the journey from Pyynikintori takes approx. 10 minutes by tram and the walk from the tram stop to the Pirtti is approx. 400m.


The singing bowl concert takes you on a sound journey, where in addition to singing bowls, many other therapeutic instruments play. A relaxing sound journey is a healing experience that offers the mind and body a moment of rest in the midst of hectic everyday life.

At the end of the evening, it is wonderful to head home relaxed and prepare for sleep.


This evening, the main instruments are traditional Tibetan singing bowls 🎶

in addition to which the sound world is enlivened by many other therapeutic instruments.


For an hour, you can lie under a blanket with your eyes closed and just relax, listening to the harmony and vibration of the bowls. Breathing becomes more even and deeper, heart rate decreases and mind calms down.


Take time for yourself ♥️


Bring your own platform (yoga mat, camping mattress, sun lounger cushion), pillow and blanket. The harmony bath is received comfortably lying under a blanket, you can also sit if you wish. You can borrow a yoga mat, let us know in the registration message if you need it. Dress in comfortable and relaxed clothes, also bring some warm clothes, because when the body relaxes it often gets cold. Remember to also bring a water bottle. At the beginning and end, there is a moment of time reserved for conversation, clinking glasses for approx. 60 min.


Price: €22 incl. VAT

Payment on site in cash or MobilePay on the day of the event at. By 15


REGISTRATION

infohealingtones@gmail.com

(registration is binding)


You will receive instructions on how to arrive by return mail and it is also a confirmation that your registration has arrived. If you do not receive a return email, please check if the email address is spelled correctly.


More information about events and upcoming events:

www.healingtones.fi

(events also in Kangasala, Lempäälä, Pirkkala and Ylöjärvi)


See you at Rientola Pirtti ✨

<3:t Terhi Jaskari


*All rights reserved.

The concert features songs from both of their own productions, as well as movie themes, French chansons, and jazz and pop classics. A four-member prog band: two guitars, bass, drums. Keyboards are also included. Three members sing. All are men. Influences include Wigwam, Genesis, and Procol Harum. The lead vocals are by the drummer. The performers are in their sixties and have been playing together since 1986. P.O.M.O.Y. has performed at Ruovesi's Noitarock in the years '88, '89, '90, and '99. Since then, they have played at various family celebrations.

At 7 PM Frank Wienne Orchestra
Frank Wienne Orchestra, a pop/rock band from Pirkanmaa, creates their own music in English, with key elements being melodies, dynamically varied songs, and a good groove.

At 8 PM Valley Nadir
We are Valley Nadir, a band from Tampere. Our music style is a blend of 90s grunge, Kingston Wall-style atmospherics, and various other influences. The band has been together for about seven years, and we've been performing regularly except during the pandemic. This spring, we will release our first full-length album, and we plan to play its songs at our upcoming gigs.

pages.name: Raw and Groowy -tour
pages.descriptionShort: This year's European tour of the Italian band DanzDas also extends to Finland! Here, as part of it, the Raw and groowy mini-tour will take place, which brings together three rough groowing bands.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Italian band DanzDas's annual European tour also extends to Finland! Here, as part of it, a Raw and groowy mini-tour will be held, which brings together three rough grooving bands. In addition to DanzDas, the band will also include Kesy from Kuopio and Gneissi from Tampere-Helsinki. 
DanszDas, who have toured extensively throughout Europe and are also heading to the United States next year, is influenced by composer Mirko Belzoni. Guitar, bass, synthesizer, drums and trumpet create a surprising and immersive mix of post-rock and electronic music in the lineup led by Belzoni that is guaranteed to move its listeners.
Kesy also brings musical joy to the tour with their rock'n'pop'n'punk music. The band, which has been praised for its unique songs and energetic and atmospheric gigs, invites its listeners on an adventure to the suburban bars of the past, the New York 77' underground and the traditional Finnish storytelling tradition.
Like DanzDaZ, Gneissi, who perform electronic music with an energetic approach, has sailed through different genres over the years. With their latest album Galefeissi, they combine tones of hyperpunk, hyperpop and punk in their music. Present are the joy of creation, reflection on identity and finding hope in a world where sincerity and irony mix into a brown mass of modeling wax from which it is impossible to separate them.
Together, DanzDas, Kesy and Gneissi create a versatile ensemble that strikes at the heart of alternative music with mischievous power, and is not worth missing. There is raw groove at these parties!

At 7 PM Gneissi

Gneissi is an electronic music duo whose music seamlessly blends organic and synthetic elements. Our songs talk about the joy of creation, the contemplation of identity, and finding hope in a world where sincerity and irony mix into a post-ironic, brown modeling clay mush, making them impossible to distinguish from each other.

pages.descriptionShort: Heinäkuussa hellitään lempääläisiä! Pääesiintyjäksi saapuu suomalaisen Stand Up:in Joulupukki, Jeesus ja Muumipappa Riku Suokas & Ystävät.
pages.descriptionLong:
Heinäkuussa hellitään lempääläisiä! Pääesiintyjäksi saapuu suomalaisen Stand Up:in Joulupukki, Jeesus ja Muumipappa Riku Suokas, joka maailmaa kiertäessään löysi Stand Up:in ja toi sen iloksemme tuhansien lärvien maahan.


Ja jotta tasapaino säilyy, niin paikalle saapuu myös Suomen nuorin koomikko – 19-vuotias Pinja Salminen. Pinja on juuri lakitettu ja maalta kaupunkiin muuttanut seurakuntanuori, joka ei aina oikein tajua, miten aikuisten maailma toimii. Pinjan komedia tuntuu siltä kuin lukisit vahingossa teinitytön päiväkirjaa: vähän naiivia, vähän tyhmää, ja juuri siksi niin hauskaa.


Lisäksi illassa esiintyvät Minna Tuominen, Janne Laahanen, Pipsa Lotta, Jonathan Lagerquist ja Joona Kotilainen.


Illan seremoniamestarina naurattaa lupsakka Lapin kasvatti ja sympaattinen höpöttäjä Pyry Valtonen, jossa on energiaa on kuin revontulissa ja valoa kuin yöttömässä yössä. Pyry on kuin yhden miehen sirkus, tivoli ja eläintarha.

pages.name: Relaxing sound journey
pages.descriptionShort: Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group audio tour on Tue 29.7.25 from 19:15-20:30 to the Pirtti, a historic building built in 1861 in the Niemenranta area.
pages.descriptionLong:
Warmly welcome to enjoy a small group sound journey on Tue 29.7.25 at 19.15-20.30 to the Pirtti, built in 1861 and full of history in the Niemenranta area.


The Pirtti is located in Lielahti next to the magnificent cattle building designed by Birger Federley. The Pirtti has been renovated and its outer walls have also regained their original yellow color.


Inside the Pirtti, there is a wonderfully serene atmosphere and the beautiful log walls and wooden floor provide a wonderful setting for a sound bowl concert.


The Pirtti has excellent transport connections to and from Tampere. For example, the journey from Pyynikintori takes approx. 10 minutes by tram and the walk from the tram stop to the Pirtti is approx. 400m.


The singing bowl concert takes you on a sound journey, where in addition to singing bowls, many other therapeutic instruments play. A relaxing sound journey is a healing experience that offers the mind and body a moment of rest in the midst of hectic everyday life.

At the end of the evening, it is wonderful to head home relaxed and prepare for sleep.


This evening, the main characters are the lovely crystal bowls 🎶

in addition to which the sound world is enlivened by many other therapeutic instruments.


For an hour, you can lie under a blanket with your eyes closed and just relax, listening to the harmony and vibration of the bowls. Breathing becomes more even and deeper, heart rate decreases and mind calms down.


Take time for yourself ♥️


Bring your own platform (yoga mat, camping mattress, sun lounger cushion), pillow and blanket. The harmony bath is received comfortably lying under a blanket, you can also sit if you wish. You can borrow a yoga mat, let us know in the registration message if you need it. Dress in comfortable and relaxed clothes, also bring some warm clothes, because when the body relaxes it often gets cold. Remember to also bring a water bottle. At the beginning and end, there is a moment of time reserved for conversation, clinking glasses for approx. 60 min.


Price: €22 incl. VAT

Payment on site in cash or MobilePay on the day of the event at. By 15


REGISTRATION

infohealingtones@gmail.com

(registration is binding)


You will receive instructions on how to arrive by return mail and it is also a confirmation that your registration has arrived. If you do not receive a return email, please check if the email address is spelled correctly.


More information about events and upcoming events:

www.healingtones.fi

(events also in Kangasala, Lempäälä, Pirkkala and Ylöjärvi)


See you at Rientola Pirtti ✨

<3:t Terhi Jaskari


*All rights reserved.

Tue 26.8 crystal bowls

pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere.


At 6 PM Luunyrkki

Luunyrkki is a three-member band from Tampere, founded in early 2023, playing Finnish-language 77/hardcore punk. Stylistically, we don't want to be compartmentalized into any specific punk subgenre, but musical influences include Ratsia, Rattus, Nuket, Riistetyt, Pelle Miljoona, etc.


At 7 PM Carillo

A few years ago, the former girl band, now lady band, Carillo returned from a break and interprets the mindset of middle-aged women in their new songs. Both the songs and performances are seasoned with rough humor and self-irony. Their repertoire still includes the best of the eighties, albeit in re-arranged versions. These ladies are visible and audible!


At 8 PM APS4

The observation class of the music play school plays fateful songs with the approach of a grass-scented park band, heading towards the inevitable and beyond with windshield wipers squeaking. The group, which has been playing together since 2015, rarely performs, so don't miss this opportunity!

pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. 

At 11 AM Kaski Savuaa trio
Kaski Savuaa trio's music is like marmalade for wounds. In Antti Kaski's (guitar, vocals) songs, which rise from the rhythmic corner of the folk bard niche, we soar from joyful surrealism to light-dimmed realism, not shying away from painful subjects. The structures of the music are greased with fierce dynamic transitions and sweetened with addictive, vocal-driven choruses. Gentle ethnic breezes hint at Kaski's history with Greek music, and the seductive harmonies of Janeveera (Eclipse Music) and Saana Kettu seal the catharsis.

pages.name: Jump Rhythm® Trio: Jump Rhythm® Live!
pages.descriptionShort: The Liikelaituri studio will feature three works by Emmy® Award-winning artist Billy Siegenfeld. The performances are full of rhythm, comedy, dance and drama.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Liikelaituri stage will feature three works by Emmy® Award-winning artist Billy Siegenfeld. The performances are full of rhythm, comedy, dance and drama. The stage will feature the play FORTITUDE or and GENTLENESS as well as excerpts of Siegenfeld’s dance works “No Way Out” and “The Sumptuous Screech of Simplicity”. The performances are based on the Standing Down Straight® method and the Jump Rhythm® technique, a vocally accompanied rhythm-driven approach to singing and dancing.


FORTITUDE or and GENTLENESS is a play about a rehearsal for a play about two people, who have known each other for years as actors, finally begin to know each other as people. This unique play with music and dance incorporates everything from terror to tap dance to titillating tango. It encompasses a relationship that comes together, falls apart, and leaves us wondering what will happen next.


Alongside the play, Peter Hammer, Saana Kulmala and Mariikka Santaharju will perform excerpts from two different pieces of Siegenfeld’s choreography: “No Way Out” and “The Sumptuous Screech of Simplicity.” With speed, energy and precise rhythmic play, Siegenfeld’s unique technique and style combines movement and expression to surprise, entertain and touch audiences’ hearts.


Show will be performed in English.


Duration: approx. 2 h

Age recommendation: 15+


Tickets

General admission 20 €

Discount ticket 10 € (retired, students, unemployed, performing arts professionals)


Location

Studio Liikelaituri, Yliopistonkatu 58 D, 33100 Tampere


The doors will open 30 mins before the start of the show.

If you require an unobstructed passage or a place for a wheelchair, please mention it when booking your ticket.


Team:


FORTITUDE or and GENTLENESS

Book, Choreography, Musical Arrangements and Additional lyrics: Billy Siegenfeld

Performers: Jordan Batta (US) and Billy Siegenfeld (US)

Director: Tucker DeGregory

Associate Directors: Tor Campbell ja Taris Hoffman

Lighting: Eric Southern

Production Stage Manager: Joshua Weckesser


No Way Out / The Sumptuous Screech of Simplicity

Choreography: Billy Siegenfeld

Performers: Peter Hammer (FRA), Saana Kulmala (FI) ja Mariikka Santaharju (FI)


In collaboration with Pirkanmaa Dance Centre.

Wonderful hits from the fifties to the seventies! At singer Kati Huvi's 70th birthday concert, you will hear evergreen hits from the 50s to the 70s. In her fifties, Kati Huvi left her job as a construction engineer and started singing. Although Kati had been singing in the yards of Pispala before she even learned to speak, fulfilling her dream required a lot of courage and persistent studying. Now, as a seventy-year-old singer, the pre-show nerves have turned into the joy of performing. Joining her are arranger, pianist, music teacher Krister Ojanen, skilled violinist Tuike Suomalainen, and bass virtuoso Tapio Ahonen. pages.name: Summer Park Concerts Extra: Dallapé
pages.descriptionShort: The legendary entertainment orchestra is celebrating its 100th anniversary.
pages.descriptionLong:
As part of Culture House Laikku’s 100th anniversary celebrations, another centenarian takes the stage at Laikunlava: Dallapé!

Europe’s longest-running entertainment orchestra, Dallapé, celebrates an impressive 100 years in 2025. To mark the occasion, Juha Hostikka & the Dallapé Orchestra will perform spectacular anniversary concerts and release a brand-new album titled Go Go.

Founded in 1925, Dallapé has turned countless songs by Finnish songwriters into timeless classics and brought the international hits of their time to Finnish audiences. The giants of Finnish orchestral entertainment from Bruno Laakko and Georg Malmstén to Kauko Käyhkö and Rauno Lehtinen have all been key figures in Dallapé’s history. Not to mention Olavi Virta, who served as the orchestra’s guitarist and lead vocalist.

In 2010, Juha Hostikka, who studied singing at the Sibelius Academy and saxophone at the Pop/Jazz Conservatory in Oulunkylä, took over as the orchestra’s leader and vocalist, restoring Dallapé to its 1930s glory.

Meticulously crafted arrangements and a swinging sound are Dallapé’s trademarks. The anniversary concert will feature evergreen favorites such as Ikkunaprinsessa, Angelique, Muistan sua Elaine, Äänisen aallot and Jälleen soittaa Dallapé.

The finely tuned 11-member orchestra will present beloved schlager melodies from across its century-long journey. An unforgettable evening of swinging and nostalgic music is guaranteed!

LINE-UP

Juha Hostikka, vocals

Anssi Nykänen, drums

Harri Rantanen, bass

Varre Vartiainen, guitar

Niko Kumpuvaara, accordion

Mauri Saarikoski, violin

Arttu Takalo, xylophone, vibraphone

Petri Puolitaival, alto saxophone, flute

Heikki Pohto, tenor saxophone

Tero Lindberg, trumpet

Antti Rissanen, trombone

pages.name: International IVV Olympiads 2025
pages.descriptionShort: At the International IVV  Olympiad 14-17.8.2025 everyone has a chance to get their own medal! The sports are walking (distances 5, 10, 20 and 42 km), cycling (20 and 40 km), swimming (300 m), canoeing and orienteering.
pages.descriptionLong: The International IVV Olympiads are a relaxed, joyful celebration of folksport, where everyone has the opportunity to earn their own Olympia medal! No time is taken or achievements are measured, but participants enjoy the joy of exercise in the beautiful scenery of Tampere. The Olympia village is located in the Central Square, where all walking routes leave and return daily. Cycling starts in front of Kauppi Sport Center and swimming in Kaukajärvi in front of the Uinti Tampere sauna. Canoeing starts from the shore of Kaupinoja and orienteering is done in the Kauppi forest. You can orientate with a larger group at a time of your choice during the Olympiads, the other sports are individual performances. The most spectacular event for the general public is on Thursday 14.8. The flag parade starts at 2 pm, followed by the opening ceremony at 3 pm, which is free for the public. See more information at: https://ivvfinland.fi/  and register!
pages.imageAlt: Info@ivvfinland.fi

pages.name: BLOCKFEST 2025: FRIDAY
pages.descriptionShort:

Before purchasing tickets, please read the current event terms and conditions here https://www.blockfest.fi/en/info/terms-
pages.descriptionLong:
Blockfest – The largest hip-hop festival in the Nordics returns to Tampere's Ratina Stadium and Ratinanniemi Event Park on August 15–16, 2025.

The festival's age limit is 18+.

Before purchasing tickets, please read the current event terms and conditions here https://www.blockfest.fi/en/info/terms-conditions/

Ticket Usage:
Tickets allow one entry to the festival area per day and will be scanned at the gate on both festival days. Tickets will not be exchanged for wristbands, except for Flex and Exclusive tickets, which include wristbands allowing re-entry to the festival area.

Accessibility:
Separate wheelchair-accessible tickets are available for the festival and can be found on Ticketmaster under each ticket type. A wheelchair-accessible ticket includes free entry for an assistant.

Individuals with other specific support needs, such as those with visual impairments, can purchase a regular festival ticket. Their assistants are also granted free entry to enable participation. If required, the need for assistance must be verified with a Disability Card, Companion Card, or another official document.

Learn more about Blockfest's accessibility here https://www.blockfest.fi/en/info/accessibility/

The contact details of customers who purchase tickets will be provided to the organizer for communication and instructions.

pages.name: Summer Park Concerts: Mot Furu, Pekka Murto & Co., Lydian
pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere. 

At 6 PM Mot Furu
Mot Furu is an indie folk/pop ensemble from Tampere, whose music combines acoustic instruments, soundscape-creating synths, and atmospheric vocals. The band performs their own material, which is full of stories about nature, friendship, and life's big questions.

At 7 PM Pekka Murto & Co.
Pekka Murto is a singer-songwriter from Vesilahti, whose songs reflect human life and the Finnish state of mind. The stories and lyrics of the songs, along with memorable melodies, are important driving forces in Pekka's music. In an atmospheric concert, Pekka's songs resonate on a summer evening with the support of a versatile ensemble.

At 8 PM Lydian
Indie artist Lydian lives and breathes music across genres. Lydian has been performing with her band for years and started her solo career in the spring of 2024 with the debut single “HULLU”. Lydian sings about the pain points of humanity, and her music features a blend of passion, experimentation, and playfulness. This is also evident in Lydian's live performances, which are characterized by strong band dynamics and delicate vocal parts.

See you in Tampere Summer Park Concerts!

pages.name: Glow Festival 2025
pages.descriptionShort: The biggest celebration of gospel music continues at Tampere's Nokia Arena next August. The event brings together different generations and backgrounds to enjoy an unprecedented fireworks display of gospel music!
pages.descriptionLong:
Finland’s biggest gospel music celebration, Glow Festival, will fill Nokia Arena again in August 2025 

The biggest gospel music celebration in Finland will return to the Nokia Arena in Tampere on August 22, 2025. After selling out last August, Glow Festival has established itself as the country’s premier gospel music event and will once again bring together over 20 top gospel artists from both Finland and the United States. One of the best-selling American gospel bands and internationally renowned Newsboys will be seen on stage along with many Finnish favorites such as Lasse Heikkilä’s Missa Concordiae, Jepa Lambert, Pekka Simojoki, and the widely known Diandra.

Gospel music has always been a uniting force and gospel songs bring to life memories that touch the heart deeply. Glow Festival brings together multiple generations from different backgrounds to enjoy a never-before-seen lineups of gospel music, with a perfect blend of nostalgia.

“The program will feature one-of-a-kind performances and collaborations specifically created for this event. Well-known artists will team up in new and exciting ways, making gospel history. This is the very essence of a gospel music celebration at its finest”, says the event’s producer, Johanna Vauto.

The event will kick off with Glow Honor: Pekka Simojoki, a concert paying tribute to the life and work of this pioneer of gospel music. The concert will feature some of Simojoki’s most beloved classics, performed by the artist himself, accompanied by Make Perttilä’s band, with special guests adding a fresh and new perspective to these timeless melodies.

The Glow Legends: Hard Gospel concert will bring together the most famous voices from the heavier side of gospel music on one stage, as they perform each other’s classics with Lasse Sakara’s Glow Band. Performers include Harri Helenius (bass’n Helen), Petri Lassila (Tera), Miika Partala (Deuteronomium), Sami Haveri (The Rain), Johanna Kultalahti (HB), and Sami Asp. Come and experience the most unforgettable moments of heavy gospel in a way that will leave a lasting impression.

The Glow Celebration main concert promises a spectacular gospel music extravaganza. Diandra, one of Finland’s most successful female artists, known from various TV shows, will perform world-famous gospel classics, featuring Jepa Lambert and the Sounds of Mercy gospelchoir. The Glow Festival stage will also see the powerful Gospel Sisters, starring Jippu, Elna Romberg, and Jepa Lambert with Sounds of Mercy, in a performance that blends strength and sensitivity in a deeply moving way. The nostalgia continues with the much-loved Missa Concordiae by Lasse Heikkilä, with soloists Elna Romberg, Heidi Simelius, Juhani Tikkanen, and Kimmo Virtanen. Additionally, the concert will feature Tommi Kalenius’ moving Elämänpuu (Tree of Life), the wonderful Eve & Ossi and the energetic Immanuel. The concert will also include Lasse Sakara’s Glow Band.

In the Glow Favorites concert, the lights will dim to a warm glow as the arena transforms into a heartwarming gathering place, reminiscent of a campfire. The talented Glow artists, along with Lasse Sakara’s campfire band, will create an intimate atmosphere by performing the most beloved songs, some of which will be chosen by public vote in early 2025. This concert will resemble the biggest campfire ever seen in Finland.

The night will be crowned by Newsboys, the Christian pop-rock pioneers who formed in 1985 and have since become one of the most successful and best-selling Christian bands of the last two decades. Known for hits like I Speak Jesus, God’s Not Dead, and Your Love Never Fails, their performance will be the grand finale of the festival.

Glow Festival will also once again present the Glow Gospel Awards, recognizing outstanding contributions to the gospel music scene.

pages.name: Tanssiteatteri MD: VOYEUR
pages.descriptionShort: The dance piece Voyeur is about the gaze and its effect on the performer and the audience. What is communication without words?
pages.descriptionLong:
I look at you when you look at me looking at you looking at me. Where does your gaze end and mine begin? The gaze does not belong to either, it is a relationship in which you participate. 


The dance piece Voyeur is about the gaze and its effect on the performer and the audience. What is communication without words?

In the performance, the audience encounters a group of performers on a stage divided by a large window. The performers are on one side of the window and the audience is on the other. The window makes tangible the basic elements of a dance performance, people gathered in the same space to look at each other. Looking and meeting the gaze can be safely explored in the space created by the Voyeur. The work is non-verbal and communicates with the audience through bodily action, light and sound. In the subtle space of the performance, even small gestures and actions begin to speak and feel precious.

pages.name: Quiet afternoon in the Moomin Museum
pages.descriptionShort: During quiet afternoons we don’t take any group reservations and the museum’s soundscape is off for a quieter visit.
pages.descriptionLong:
The Moomin Museum is an experiential art museum that also includes a Moomin-themed soundscape and enjoyable events with guided tours. We hope that all of our visitors – including those who do not enjoy extra sounds – could experience the ambiance of the museum, Moomin stories, and the original illustrations by Tove Jansson on display.


During the Quiet afternoons, no events will be held in the museum, and we will not conduct guided tours or accept group reservations. The museum's soundscape will be completely turned off. You can also borrow earplugs for your visit. Thus, you can explore the museum with peace of mind during the quiet afternoons. Our staff will be available to assist you as usual. Normal admission fee: €14.50 / €7.

pages.descriptionShort: Summer Park Concerts brings a diverse range of music and culture close to you!
pages.descriptionLong:
Free open-air concerts offer experiences for everyone around Tampere.


At 6 PM Flaudient

Flaudient is an energetic four-member youth band from Vesilahti, founded in 2023, that plays death/black metal, occasionally incorporating some melodic elements. Their gigs feature their own material as well as covers (e.g., Death, Amorphis).


At 7 PM Suden Hetki

Suden Hetki is a Finnish-language metal band from Tampere, founded in 2018. Their musical production navigates through atmospheric and grand melodies, heavy riffs, and strong narrative interpretation, leading the listener to the borders of sensitivity and partial madness, taking them on a journey into the darkest depths of the human mind.


At 8 PM Decreation

Decreation is a death metal band composed of old school veterans. Decreation will release their debut album in the spring through the French label Khaoszophy. If expertly played death metal makes your heart pound and your head bang, Decreation is a must-see live.

pages.name: Wild herb and mushroom tours in English 2025
pages.descriptionShort: Welcome to the summer wild vegetable tour to Haihara and mushroom tour to Hervantajärvi. The language of the tours is English.
pages.descriptionLong:
Welcome to the summer wild vegetable tour to Haihara and mushroom tour to Hervantajärvi. The language of the tours is English. Your guide will be environmental biologist (FM), teacher, herbal and natural product advisor Tuomas Lilleberg, who invites you to explore the surrounding natural marvel.

Notice: Both trips are limited to 25 people. Registration can be done by sending an email to ninjosanto(at)gmail.com.


To 15.5. klo 17 Wild herb tour Haihara

Welcome to the summer wild vegetable tour to Haiharan kartano in Kaukajärvi to enjoy summer nature and its offerings. You will learn to identify and collect a few wild vegetables for food. You do not need previous experience, but an interest in wild vegetables is enough.

Bring a few paper bags, a water bottle and, if you wish, collecting gloves and a small snack.

The trip is limited to 25 people, and registration can be done by sending an email to ninjosanto(at)gmail.com. Please also include your phone number in the email. You can inform one person with you. You can also register for a reserve place. Also children are more than welcome.

Meeting point: At the main doors of Haiharan kartano, Haiharankatu 30.


To 28.8. klo 17 Mushroom tour Hervantajärvi

Welcome to a mushroom tour in the Hervantajärvi forest area that provides diverse habitats for mushrooms to grow. On this tour you’ll know more about edible mushrooms in Finland and how to recognize, pick and use them.

You´ll learn more about the delicious culinary treasures of the nearby forests and your mushroom-hawk-eye will definitely sharpen. Expect to be surprised how exotic mushrooms of the forest can be! Also children are more than welcome.

We will focus on edible mushrooms and their look-alikes and to the ones you should be aware of: the toxic species.

The trip is limited to 25 people, and registration can be done by sending an email to ninjosanto(at)gmail.com. Please also include your phone number in the email. You can inform one person with you. You can also register for a reserve place.

Meeting point: Makkarajärvenkatu 35. We start walking towards the Makkarajärvi camping area and take a look at the mushrooms we find. Although we focus on edible species, all mushrooms are interesting to take a look at.


Take with you:

  • Outdoor clothing and shoes, an airy basket, a little snack and a water bottle. In case you don't have a basket, bring a container if you wish to carry mushrooms home.
  • A knife, note equipment and mushroom literature is also useful.

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: Season opening: Ode to Joy
pages.descriptionShort: Tampere Philharmonic's season begins with Sebastian Fagerlund’s orchestral whirlwind Ignite and Ludwig van Beethoven’s Ninth Symphony, a timeless symbol of joy and universal friendship.
pages.descriptionLong:
Matthew Halls, conductor 

Helena Juntunen, soprano 

Tuija Knihtilä, alto 

Tuomas Katajala, tenor 

Arttu Kataja, bass 

Tampere Philharmonic Choir  


Sebastian Fagerlund: Ignite 

Ludwig van Beethoven: Symphony No. 9 


In 1824, Ludwig van Beethoven made history with a symphony that culminates in the shared joy of all humanity. Though the dream of universal brotherhood remains unrealized, Ode to Joy is a powerful reminder of the utopia we must never stop pursuing. This season’s featured composer, Sebastian Fagerlund, made his breakthrough with the Teosto Prize-winning Ignite—an electrifying celebration of controlled chaos. Blending sci-fi soundscapes, medieval melodies, and exotic rhythms, it launches the listener on a thrilling journey to the eye of the storm—and back. 


Season series concert | includes an intermission


Tickets: adults 42 € / pensioners 32 € / students, unemployed, conscripts and children under 18 yrs 20 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Nightrun 2025
pages.descriptionShort: Nightrun 2025
pages.descriptionLong:
Nightrun 2025



The venue for Night Run will once again be Ratinnanniemi Event Park, where the start and finish of the event will be located. The running route itself will run through the centre of Tampere and the Tammerkoski area.


The event gates will open at 18:00, from which point you can gather to discuss your running plan and tactics. The start will take place in the dark at 21:00. When you register, you can choose the starting group where you feel most at home. However, it is not advisable to participate in the run with your teeth in your mouth. You can choose either a 5km or 7.5km run for your running distance.


The finish line for the run will close at 23:00, when it is time to head to our partners' facilities to enjoy the after-games. You can then dance the rest of your energy away at the official after-party, where the awards ceremony will also take place starting at around 00:30.


Now gather your own running team, choose your team outfits and join us for the toughest running event of the autumn through idyllic Tampere!

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: Verses of the Heart
pages.descriptionShort: Stravinsky’s Petrushka leaps between styles, while Rachmaninoff’s symphony overflows with melody. In this concert evening featuring two works, the orchestra itself shines as the soloist.
pages.descriptionLong:
Matthew Halls, conductor 


Igor Stravinsky: Petrushka 

Sergei Rachmaninoff: Symphony No. 2 


The resounding success of his Second Piano Concerto lifted Sergei Rachmaninoff out of years of depression. From this creative resurgence rose his Second Symphony—the lush pinnacle of his most prolific period. Its sweeping melodies sing of a love that soars freely and embraces the full spectrum of life. Between The Firebird and The Rite of Spring, Igor Stravinsky composed Petrushka—a ballet about a puppet driven mad by love. Folk tunes, frenzied fights, and obsessively tilting rhythms make Petrushka one of orchestral literature’s most captivating works. 


Season series concert | includes an intermission | pre-concert talk at 6 PM


Tickets: adults 34 € / pensioners 26 € / students, unemployed and conscripts 16 € / children under 18 years 10 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Tanssiteatteri MD: Dancing Moominvalley
pages.descriptionShort: Dance Theatre MD has evoked national treasures of Finland, the Moomins, into dance. Dancing Moominvalley is visually spectacular, fully composed dance theatre piece for the whole family.
pages.descriptionLong:
Dance Theatre MD has evoked national treasures of Finland, the Moomins, into dance. Dancing Moominvalley is visually spectacular, fully composed dance theatre piece for the whole family. This popular, award-winning, all over the globe seen performance is based on Tove Jansson’s book The Tales from the Moominvalley.  The performance opens up the well known themes of Tove Jansson’s books: invisibility, otherness and difference.


The basis of the visual world of the piece are the original illustrations of Tove Jansson in the collection of The Moominvalley of the Tampere Art Museum (nowadays Moomin Museum). The world of the illustrations and the tales of Jansson are now interpreted on stage by the means of dance theatre.


The piece is choreographed by Dance Theatre MD’s choreographer Samuli Roininen and the music is composed by Heikki Mäenpää. Dance, music and visual elements such as projections intertwine to interpret the holistic and fascinating world created in Jansson’s tales.

The project Dancing Moominvalley @ Shanghai Expo was featured in the Finnish cultural program at EXPO 2010 and was presented at EXPO 2010 on August 2010. The project also recieved Shanghai EXPO 2010 Culture Award as the only one of the Finnish Pavilion Culture Program. In spring 2020 Dancing Moominvalley celebrated it’s 10 year anniversary!

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: The Magic of Mozart
pages.descriptionShort: Two world-class artists specializing in Viennese Classicism—conductor Jonathan Cohen and pianist Kristian Bezuidenhout—dedicate the evening to the masterworks of W. A. Mozart.
pages.descriptionLong:
Jonathan Cohen, conductor 

Kristian Bezuidenhout, piano 


Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: Don Giovanni Overture 

Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: Piano Concerto No. 24 

Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: Symphony No. 39 


Jonathan Cohen, artistic director of the world-renowned early music ensemble Les Violons du Roy, makes his debut in Tampere. The program is devoted to W. A. Mozart’s late masterpieces: the stormy Don Giovanni Overture and the grand E-flat major Symphony, both brimming with depth beneath classical elegance. Kristian Bezuidenhout, one of today’s most acclaimed period specialists and winner of multiple major recording awards, brings his artistry to the intensely dramatic and passionate C minor Piano Concerto.  


Season series concert | includes an intermission | pre-concert talk at 6 PM


Tickets: adults 34 € / pensioners 26 € / students, unemployed and conscripts 16 € / children under 18 years 10 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Afternoon of Fauns: Up and Away!
pages.descriptionShort: Afternoon of Fauns takes you on a soaring journey. Expect a medley of highlights, from virtuosic solos and lush, romantic delicacies to an all-out disco finale to the beat of the ’90s.
pages.descriptionLong:
Peter Maxwell Davies: Sea Eagle, Op.103

Aleksi Mäkimattila, horn


Maurice Ravel: Sonate posthume for violin and piano

Riikka Marttila, violin and Eeva Havulehto, piano


Madeleine Dring: Trio for Flute, Oboe and Piano

Annaleena Jämsä, flute, Simeon Overbeck, oboe and Hanna-Leena Savolainen, piano


Aaron Jay Kernis: 100 Greatest dance hits 

Terapia Q: Lotta Laaksonen, violin, István Szalay, violin, Anne Korhonen, viola and Maija Juuti, cello featuring Janne Malinen, guitar


An innovator of 20th-century music, Maurice Ravel dismissed his early, romantically effusive violin sonata as too conventional and left it unpublished. Swedish composer Madeleine Dring’s trio dances with neoclassical lightness, while Pulitzer Prize-winner Aaron Jay Kernis channels the pulsing energy of ’90s disco in 100 Greatest Dance Hits. Peter Maxwell Davies’s Sea Eagle sends a solitary French horn soaring on a breathtaking, virtuosic flight.


The concert is hosted by composer Minna Leinonen. The concert lasts about 2 hours including an intermission. 


Tickets: adults 18 € / pensioners 11 € / students, unemployed, conscripts and children under 18 yrs 7 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: In the Embrace of Rosenkavalier
pages.descriptionShort: A dazzling concerto, nostalgic waltzes, and a lush modern soundscape—rising conductor Kristian Sallinen leads a colourful concert with cellist Senja Rummukainen as the soloist.
pages.descriptionLong:
Kristian Sallinen, conductor 

Senja Rummukainen, cello 


Magnus Lindberg: Concerto for Orchestra 

Camille Saint-Saëns: Cello Concerto No. 1 

Richard Strauss: Rosenkavalier Suite 


One of Finland’s most promising young conductors, Kristian Sallinen, makes his debut with Tampere Philharmonic’s season series with a program that celebrates the full spectrum of orchestral color. Magnus Lindberg’s Concerto for Orchestra brings every player into the spotlight as a soloist and as part of the ensemble. Camille Saint-Saëns’s First Cello Concerto, a showcase of virtuosity, brims with brilliance and lyrical charm, perfectly matched by the exceptional Senja Rummukainen. Richard Strauss’s Der Rosenkavalier secured the composer’s place among opera's greats. The suite, drawn from its most cherished scenes, sweeps listeners into a world of love and longing, wrapped in the elegance of Viennese waltzes.   


Season series concert | includes an intermission | pre-concert talk at 6 PM


Tickets: adults 34 € / pensioners 26 € / students, unemployed and conscripts 16 € / children under 18 years 10 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: Echoes of Kalevala
pages.descriptionShort: Echoes of Kalevala is an audiovisual concert experience celebrating the epic’s 190th anniversary. The performance blends the ancient Finno-Ugric tradition of rune singing with echoes of pop music.
pages.descriptionLong:
N.N., conductor

Ida Elina, kantele


The songs, composed and written by kantele artist Ida Elina and inspired by Finland’s national epic, the Kalevala, bring the legacy of rune singers to life in a new way. This unique concert evening features visual elements drawn from the short film Under the Northern Skies. Echoes of the Kalevala premiered at Hyvinkääsali on February 22, and the Tampere concert on October 3 will mark the premiere of the orchestral arrangement, created by Erno Tiittanen.


Tickets: adults 35 € / pensioners 30 € / students, unemployed, conscripts and children under 18 years 16 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fee to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Moomin and emotions - experiential shadow theater workshop
pages.descriptionShort: In the workshop, children learn basic shadow theatre, get to know Moomin books and practice recognizing emotions.
pages.descriptionLong:
Moomins and emotions - a shadow theater workshop


 In the workshop, children learn basic shadow theatre, get to know Moomin books and practice recognizing emotions.


 As a warm-up, feelings are named and the effect of the feeling on the body and voice is tested. We try out the shadows of different Moomin characters in a small theater. Viewers can name characters and emotions they see at the shadow screen. Finall subject is the fear of the dark. Often something scary turns out to be harmless. In pairs, the children face a large shadow of the bogey, and start dancing together, the shadow bogey shrinks and dances away.


Duration: 45 min


Target group: 4-8 years. (suitable for all ages)

pages.name: Peeks into the Dancing Moominvalley
pages.descriptionShort: Based on Tove Jansson’s book The Tales from the Moominvalley.
pages.descriptionLong:
Dance Theatre MD: Peeks into the Dancing Moominvalley


﻿Peeks into the Dancing Moominvalley is an interactive little sister of the whole 50 minute long contemporary dance theatre piece Dancing Moominvalley. This popular, award-winning, all over the globe seen performance is based on Tove Jansson’s book The Tales From the Moominvalley. The performance opens up the well known themes of Tove Jansson’s books: invisibility, otherness and difference.

Performance language Finnish. Duration 40 minutes. Recommended for all ages.



Working group

Choreography: Samuli Roininen

Composing and video: Heikki Mäenpää

Costume design: Carmela Wager

Lighting design: Sari Mayer

Costumes made by Osk Työhuone Hengari

Wigs and hats: Anni Hiro

Photos: Harri Hinkka ©Moomin Characters™

Production: Dance Theatre MD

Performance rights Agency North / ©Moomin Characters™

Based on Tove Jansson’s book The Tales from the Moominvalley.

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: King of the French Horn
pages.descriptionShort: There are thousands of horn players, but only one Stefan Dohr. The principal horn of Berlin Philharmonic shines as the soloist in a new concerto framed by Sibelius' Tapiola and Brahms' Symphony No 1.
pages.descriptionLong:
Matthew Halls, conductor 

Stefan Dohr, horn 


Jean Sibelius: Tapiola 

Steingrímur Rohloff: Horn Concerto, Finnish premiere (co-commission by the Tampere Philharmonic, Aalborg Symphony Orchestra & Mecklenburgische Staatskapelle) 

Johannes Brahms: Symphony No. 1 


Composers are lining up to write for Stefan Dohr—arguably the world’s finest horn player. This evening marks the Finnish premiere of a striking new work by Icelandic composer Steingrímur Rohloff, co-commissioned by three orchestras. A contemporary critic once declared that if Tapiola were the only work Sibelius had ever written, it would still secure his place among the most significant composers—and he was right. The same could be said of Brahms’s First Symphony, a masterpiece that took two decades to perfect, surpassing all expectations and swiftly earning the nickname “Beethoven’s Tenth.”   


Season series concert | includes an intermission | pre-concert talk at 6 PM


Tickets: adults 34 € / pensioners 26 € / students, unemployed and conscripts 16 € / children under 18 years 10 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: The Long Goodbye
pages.descriptionShort: The Ninth remains the most personal of all nine symphonies by Gustav Mahler. Its farewell themes echo the beautiful memories of a life lived and the finality of approaching death.
pages.descriptionLong:
Matthew Halls, conductor

 

Gustav Mahler: Symphony No. 9 


Gustav Mahler etched his name into history with autobiographical symphonies, each a portrait of a hero wandering through an unknown land, caught in a constant struggle between art, love, and existential questions. Mahler composed his final symphony in the aftermath of personal tragedies. Little did he know he would die just two years later; yet, his Ninth Symphony has long been seen as his musical testament—an elegy overflowing with memories, a farewell where the sand in the hourglass inevitably slips toward the great unknown. This iconic work in the symphonic canon was last heard in Tampere 12 years ago.  


Season series concert | no intermission | pre-concert talk at 6 PM


Tickets: adults 34 € / pensioners 26 € / students, unemployed and conscripts 16 € / children under 18 years 10 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Moomin and emotions - experiential shadow theater workshop
pages.descriptionShort: In the workshop, children learn basic shadow theatre, get to know Moomin books and practice recognizing emotions.
pages.descriptionLong:
Moomins and emotions - a shadow theater workshop


 In the workshop, children learn basic shadow theatre, get to know Moomin books and practice recognizing emotions.


 As a warm-up, feelings are named and the effect of the feeling on the body and voice is tested. We try out the shadows of different Moomin characters in a small theater. Viewers can name characters and emotions they see at the shadow screen. Finall subject is the fear of the dark. Often something scary turns out to be harmless. In pairs, the children face a large shadow of the bogey, and start dancing together, the shadow bogey shrinks and dances away.


Duration: 45 min


Target group: 4-8 years. (suitable for all ages)

pages.name: Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra: Passionate Romantics
pages.descriptionShort: From Tchaikovsky’s overflowing emotions to Mendelssohn’s virtuoso violin concerto, this evening is dedicated to the heartfelt sounds of Romantic composers.
pages.descriptionLong:
Julie Røssland, conductor 

Henning Kraggerud, violin


Pyotr Tchaikovsky: Romeo and Juliet (Fantasy Overture) 

Felix Mendelssohn: Violin Concerto 

Johan Svendsen: Symphony No. 1


The Romantics brought human emotions and superhuman skills to new heights. Mendelssohn’s concerto showcases violin artistry at its finest, while in Tchaikovsky’s Romeo and Juliet, love blooms only to fade tragically. Norwegian Romantics are known for their folk music influences, but Johan Svendsen offered a grander symphonic surge that elevated Norwegian orchestral music to international prominence. Julie Røssland, the young talent from last year’s concert Stars of Tomorrow, makes her season series debut with the Tampere Philharmonic. Charismatic violinist Henning Kraggerud returns to enchant the audience with his captivating stage presence.    


Season series concert | includes an intermission | pre-concert talk at 6 PM


Tickets: adults 34 € / pensioners 26 € / students, unemployed and conscripts 16 € / children under 18 years 10 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Afternoon of Fauns: Shivers and Glimmers
pages.descriptionShort: The haunting mystery of Dmitri Shostakovich’s music pierces deep into the soul. His Eighth String Quartet, born in the ruins of Dresden, is a bittersweet danse macabre on lost humanity’s grave.
pages.descriptionLong:
Mélanie "Mel" Bonis: Sonata for Flute and Piano

Nina Johnson, flute and Hanna-Leena Savolainen, piano


Grażyna Bacewicz: Quartet for Four Violins

Lea Antola, Maija Wesslund, Linda Halme and Kaia Voitka, violin


Dmitri Shostakovich: String Quartet No. 8

FINESTre: Kati Tuominen-Heroja, violin, Heidi Kuula, violin, Heili Hannikainen, viola and Elina Rouvali, cello


Grażyna Bacewicz, a trailblazer of Polish modernism, softened her style under political pressure — her neoclassical quartet shimmers with joy and the illusion of ease. Dmitri Shostakovich traveled to bomb-ravaged Dresden to write film music, but in the shadow of the ruins, he composed his Eighth String Quartet — a haunting exploration of the darkest corners of the human psyche. The dreamlike flute sonata by forgotten French Romantic Mel Bonis might just be the most beautiful piece you’ve never heard. 


The concert is hosted by composer Minna Leinonen. The concert lasts about 2 hours including an intermission. 


Tickets: adults 18 € / pensioners 11 € / students, unemployed, conscripts and children under 18 yrs 7 €


You can buy tickets from the Tampere Hall ticket office, Aplodi and the Lippupiste online store (Lippupiste adds service and order fees to the ticket prices, along with possible delivery and payment method charges).

pages.name: Tanssiteatteri MD: VIRNE-SMIRK
pages.descriptionShort: What does a smile sound like? What would you include in a time capsule for future generations?
pages.descriptionLong:
What does a smile sound like? What would you include in a time capsule for future generations?


The smell of soil. Wedding dance steps. Things with wings and tails. Earthworms and beetles. A child’s grin at a parent, and that special glow when somebody smiles.

Combining movement and music with the vivid drawings of visual artist Petri Seppä, Virne – Smirk turns the stage into a living and breathing universe of rhythms. This clever and optimistic contem porary dance piece takes you on a floating electroacoustic ride through turbulence and serenity, tuned to the sounds of composer Minna Leinonen.


Choreography and direction Samuli Roininen

Dance Suvi Eloranta, Anniina Kumpuniemi, Mari Rosendahl 

Music Minna Leinonen

Musicians on recording Maa, jonka jätämme (2024): Malla Vivolin (flute), Children’s choir Tactus of Pirkanmaan musiikkiopisto, choir director Emmi Kleemola, Vyöry (2022): Antti Leinonen (accordion) and the Ostrobothnian Chamber Orchestra (strings), conductor Tomas Djupsjöbacka 

Sound design, audio technology Henri Puolitaival

Drawings, projection Petri Seppä 

Light design Sari Mayer  

Costume design Ella Kauppinen

Photo Harri Hinkka
